Reviews.Title: “Highs and lows”
Reviews.Author: Bryna T
Reviews.Content: Pros: Rooms are spacious and clean. We were in a deluxe king room which was large enough for a family of 4 utilizing the queen pull out sofa. Â Location is safe and tucked away within the historic old Montreal area. Complimentary breakfast buffet is substantial and they even have take away containers for afternoon snacks. Â We also enjoyed the microwave and in room fridge.Â  Cons: The housekeeping staff is extremely unfriendly. No greeting in the hall unless you consider a smirk and begrudging good morning mumble when you annoy them with a greeting. Â We also asked for beer glasses and were told we should use the room 4oz water glasses. Weird in the land of microbrews and a hotel with room service that serves beer.Â  All in all, not a bad stay but in the same breath, not a good one either. Common courtesies go a long way. I'm a huge fan of this chain but Marriott missed the mark this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: mojo1107
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a well priced, clean, friendly hotel that is centrally located then look no further. The room we had was a little on the small side for a suite, but still very comfortable. No complaints at all. The location cannot be beat, fine dining, night life, pubs, Notre-Dame cathedral, place St-Jacques, the Old Port, Chinatown, all within walking distance. A quick cab ride will get you to other Montreal hot spots, Crescent street, The Main (upper St-Laurent boulevard), little Italy.. Montrealers are fantastic, very helpful and always polite. Enjoyed our stay and will be returning soon. A must while in Montreal is Schwartz's deli for a medium lean smoked meat... Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the old Montreal, fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: delphinebs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend, booked online. I wanted a hotel in the old Montreal and they are quite expensive. This one was lovely. Right in the Vieux port, plenty of restaurants around. parking is Valet 21 Dollars a day. The rooms were very clean, big enough for us (2 adults and 2 young children per room) however, a suite with king bed + sofabed would be small for 4 adults. The rooms are not really suites, there are no separate bedroom or kitchen or desk but the areas are separated with alcoves. There is a desk with accessible plugs and free wifi, a microwave and sink and disposable cutlery. The bathroom is standard with bath. Overall the rooms are above standards for the price. The TV is a nice flat screen with cable. Best of all, it is quiet! The pool is quite small but warm and the hot tub is really hot. We haven't used the training equipement but it is next to the pool and new. Breakfast is included and quite nice. We have travelled in many hotels and free breakfast is not usually that nice. Everything is clean, there is plenty of choice and even hot food ccoked frequently. There is also a small business center where you can copy and print documents. Location wise, you can walk around Old Montreal and are about 15 min to the underground network. All the staff are bilingual.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Old Montreal for romantic get away. (But try to get room on higher floors)”
Reviews.Author: jamesmorton
Reviews.Content: Typical Marriott property: very clean, well set up. A little hard to find but well located in Old Montreal. Near to all restuarants and attractions in Old Montreal -- large comfortable rooms with a good breakfast included: a good value for where it is. Would stay there again. (Only negative, the pool is very small and try not to stay on Floor 1 -- pool is on that floor and rooms don't have a great (any?) view).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Red-Barchetta2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springhill Suites for Long weekend with my wife and teenager. The hotel was in a great location. It is right in the heart of Old Montreal. The hotel entrance front is right on Rue Saint Jean Baptiste. But the road is small and, when driving, it can look like ally way. It should be no problem with a GPS. The hotel has parking right there so just leave your keys and the front desk when you check in and the valet will park it for you (it is the same cost as parking it yourself). Because of the location we just parked the car there all weekend, they do have in and out service. During our stay we either walked around the Old Montreal or used the â€œMetroâ€�. The closest entrance to the Metro (Place-d'Armes Stattion) is about .3 miles away and really an easy walk. The metro is very easy to use and you can buy and 1 or 3 day passes. They donâ€™t have a 2 day pass but the three day is the same cost. With the metro you can get to all the major attractions and areas. As a example we used it to go to St Joesphâ€™s, Rue St Cathernine, the underground city , Little Italy and even St Helenâ€™s island. Now there is some healthy walking involved but compared to finding a place, parking and paying for parking this is very convenient and less of a hassle. Also from the hotel it is an easy walk around all of Old Montreal and fairly close to the Notre Dame Cathedral. The hotel itself was decent not bad not great. the rooms were clean and had a microwave, a kitchenette with a counter, sink and cabinet. The only real negative was the layout was a little odd and when we opened the pull out bed it was very tight and hard to get by, and the bed wasnâ€™t as comfortable compared to other Marriottâ€™s I have stayed at. The hotel offers complementary breakfast which has your standard, cereal, waffles, yogurts, breads and frits. They also offer a hot item like scrambled eggs, sausage, ham etc. Thye hotel was very quiet considering its location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. So over all because of the location I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for tourists”
Reviews.Author: kkolodz
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. The location is great. It is located right in the heart of Old Montreal with easy walking access to Notre Dame Basilica, the port, shops, restaurants, metro. It is in the perfect location for tourists looking to sight-see. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Small living room area, kitchen area with mini fridge, micowave, and sink, comfortable bed, and large bathroom area. We parked our car for $21/day which allows you to come and go as you please. Valet service and parked in a garage overnight. We also took advantage of the free breakfast. On the weekends, it was offered from 7-10am and offered a large selection of items. I enjoyed the waffle makers. I was not impressed with the eggs (tasted like fake-eggs) but overall, it was a good selection for something free. Included cereals, yogurts, fruit, pastries/breads, egg dish, meat dish, and waffle makers. Restocked often so the food was fresh which was a plus. The front desk was friendly. Room was ready upon arrival which was slightly earlier than check-in. Check out was a freeze. Overall, I would absolutely stay in this hotel again and recommend to anyone visitng Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Nailmark
Reviews.Content: Once we found the entrance...no thanks to the Sat Nav :-) We were quite surprised to find the hotel was very nice and in a great part of the town. As always the room was exactly what you expect from Springhill Suites, clean and comfortable. Would recommend this hotel and make sure you go to the restaurant at the hotel, it is the oldest "Inn" in North America!

Reviews.Title: “Average nothing more”
Reviews.Author: salvatore70
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are spacious and very clean. The staff is polite. The only thing that needs improvement is their breakfast. I know it is included but the only fruit were bananas that were too ripe to eat. I believe breakfasts should have some fruits. The eggs were a little strange they seemed to red peppers mixed in. I did not try them. The chocolatine's were not fresh at all, although the apple turnovers were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kkyh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in February 2012 with a few friends. The room was fairly big (2 double beds and a sofa bed) and very comfortable for 4 people. Service was good - they allowed us a late checkout at 2pm! - and we had no issues with check-in or parking ($21/night and good until 4pm the next day). The rate included breakfast and the food was decent, they had waffle makers for you to use so that was a nice touch. Location is good if you are looking to stay in Old Montreal. Close to restaurants, cafes and good night life. However, if you want to go shopping along St. Denis or St. Catherine, you'd likely want to take the metro or a cab. We went to Piano Rouge in the evening and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and the best part is, it's literally a 1 minute walk from the hotel which is great when you're coming home at 3am! I'd stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for accommodation in this part of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Old Montreal Charm”
Reviews.Author: Mason2012
Reviews.Content: SpringHill is located conveniently in old Montreal. The rooms were very noisy specially those facing the street where many drunk people keep shouting and screaming late at night. The breakfast buffet is convenient and has acceptable variety

Reviews.Title: “Montreal visit”
Reviews.Author: Hank P
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly, rooms and hotel clean, swimming pool, hot tub and exercise room was a bonus. We were 2 adults and 2 teenagers, staying Friday and Saturday night. Hotel close to lots of excellent restaurants and pubs. The Igloo festival happened to be on - bonus. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ecargo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on New Year's Eve 2011, just for one night. Compared to New York prices, it was a relative bargain, as our rate included parking (often not included in Montreal and expensive at $20 and up per night), free breakfast, and a $25 gas card (which they ran out of so refunded us the money). We booked a one bedroom suite, which was spacious, with a kitchenette, bedroom, and living room, as well as a couple of large closets. Our room was basic but comfortable, with the usual comfy Marriott bed. Check-in was friendly and efficient, and the desk staff were extremely helpful at answering our questions about how to navigate the Metro and other questions about the area. The location is what makes this place special. Located in the heart of the old port area (Old Montreal), the Springhill Suites affords access to the quaint cobblestoned streets of the old district as well as being within a short walking distance of Chinatown, Rue St. Catherine, the mall, and various Metro stops. Because many shopkeepers take the week between Xmas and New Year's off, we did find that the dining and shopping in Old Montreal were quite limited, but we managed to find a really great breakfast joint (Le Gros Jambon) nearby. Delicious food in a funky diner-style eatery; reasonable and unexpectedly gourmet! We took the metro across town (on the north side of Mont Royal) to eat at Le Petit Italien on the recommendation of a chef friend originally from Montreal--it's worth the trip on the easy-to-navigate Metro! Back to the hotel, where we kicked back with some wine and rang in the New Year. The hotel is nicely soundproofed, so we didn't hear much in the way of festivities (other than a seemingly HUGE--from the sound of them--mob of revelers in the street after the fireworks displays; no amount of soundproofing could keep their merriment out!) Overall, this was a nice place to stay and we were very satisfied with the comfort, amenities, and staff. The included breakfast was good, and the valet parking was convenient. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AstroJunq
Reviews.Content: This is a 4-star hotel with a perfect location for a tourist, right in the middle of the Old MontrÃ©al. It is a safe choice with a low probability of being disappointed (but not amazed either), especially if youâ€™re able to find a good package deal. The rooms are suites, meaning that there is a living room and a kitchen, besides the bedroom. The room had no view to speak of, but it was reasonably well maintained, pretty spacious and comfortable. The only complaint I have is that the air conditioning/heater was very loud, so I had to turn it off in order to sleep. The service at the front desk was professional and efficient, and the lobby is functional and unassuming. The breakfast was proper, but nothing to write home about. A positive point is that internet access was included, of good quality, and the password was given to me at check-in, I didn't even had to ask. There are also a pool and a gym which, although small, are decent and provide another entertainment/exercise choice. The valet parking worked well for us, although I couldn't say the price, since it was included on our package deal. The best thing, however, is to leave the car there and explore the city on foot and on the subway, which is also close to the hotel I would easily recommend this hotel for a tourist in MontrÃ©al, especially if you will make use of the kitchen facilities.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely base to walk around Montreal”
Reviews.Author: InfrequentFlyer22
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its close proximity to Notre Dame Basillica (definitely worth a look regardless of your religious beliefs), while it is not located on a main road, it is still easy to walk around Montreal from here. I should mention that the hotel has a carpark you can use (at a charge) but we didn't bother. We had two interconnected rooms (211 and 213) and both were nice and clean. Overnight we could hear some traffic noise, but generally it was OK. The beds were comfortable, if not a little warm. The complimentary breakfast buffet was served on the mezzanine level of the hotel and is fairly standard (waffles, porridge, cold cereal, toast, some fruit, juices and coffee). The staff kept everything well stocked and fresh. We didn't eat dinner at the restaurant next to the hotel, but there were plenty of options nearby. The staff were lovely and helpful. We weren't in Montreal very long, but I would definitely stay here again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “The heart of Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: apple_green_10
Reviews.Content: The Springhill Suites is in a great location in Old Montreal. You are literally 3mintues away from the beautiful Basilica of Notre Dame and you'll never go hungry! What I would recommend is not even bothering for a rental car it seemed to me like a hassle to park at the hotel. My father and I were perfectly fine with walking all over Montreal. One time we even walked from downtown to the hotel in around 15 minutes. As far as the complimentary breakfast goes, its delicious. There's a variety of food and the staff is very attentive. The room we stayed in was the larger suite and it fit us so comfortably. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel is that the front desk is horrible about returning phone calls. All in all I would choose this hotel over all the others because of it's convenient location and wonderful staff

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST IN OLD MONTREAL”
Reviews.Author: SalesGuyinCANADA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the only place to stay in Old Montreal. Centrally located its close to art Galleries, restaurants and the local wine store. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Small for a residence Inn but none the less agreat stay. I stayed on the 3rd floor. The only initial worry I had was the smell of smoke from a fireplace in the halls. This did not impact my room at all. They were kind enough to book a taxi for an early flight. The front desk told me the cab would be 38.00 that this was a locked in rate. The driver stung me for 45.00.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for kids”
Reviews.Author: AmyEDA
Reviews.Content: This is a great all around hotel in a fantastic location! The room itself was very clean and a good layout. Service was excellent. Everyone was really friendly. I had requested a roll away bed when I made my reservation and it wasn't in the room when we checked in. I called to request one and it was in our room in about 5 minutes. There was a partition in the room dividing the living space from the bedroom space that was good for when we put the kids to bed, we could still watch tv and hang out until we were ready to go to sleep. There was a small fridge and microwave which was nice to have in the room. People raved about the breakfast. I thought is was just ok. It did save us a ton of money not having to buy breakfast. There were eggs and self made waffles, hash brown, cereal, bagels, toast, pastries, yogurt, coffee and juice. It only goes until 9:30 and you really need to get there before 8:45 or many things are gone and they don't replenish it close to ending time. We were tired of it by then last day and went out for breakfast. But it was good to have. The pool was a highlight for us. Many people complained it was too small, but that's what we loved about it. My kids swam twice a day and loved it. The pool was shallow enough for them to stand in it all the way around, but deep enough for them to still be able to have a great time. The hot tub was great as well. My kids easily swam for over an hour at a time and had a blast. There was hardly ever anyone else there either. There was a lot of little coffee places within a short walking distance which was nice and other great things to see and do. The only complaint with our room was lack of storage space. We had to keep all of our clothes in our suitcase which was a little annoying, but manageable. The bathroom was huge and nice. Only complaint about that was the shower was all glass, so no one could shower and have any privacy if anyone else needed to use the bathroom. Also, our bathroom lock didn't work, so that was a little tricky with 3 little kids:) But, an all around Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: travelNYC
Reviews.Content: We (parents + toddler) stayed at the hotel on Labor Day weekend, first week of September. Rooms: Very clean, spacious and comfortable. Not much of a view, looking into offices. Free toddler bed was provided. Location: Great for tourists with easy access to buses, taxis and a short walk to the subway. Old Montreal is literally around the corner, a ton of restaurants and activities on the river. Food: Free breakfast buffet was excellent. Every day the menu changed and they were always bringing in freshly baked pastries. Service: Staff was helpful with directions, schedules and recommendations to restaurants. We used the pool/hot tub as well as the business services and they were maintained well. Free WiFi too! This was a very comfortable hotel and central to hit all the tourist spots around Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite MontrÃ©al Vieux Port hotel”
Reviews.Author: witheachother
Reviews.Content: We often go to Montreal for weekend getaways. We very much enjoy the scenery, activities and restaurants in the Old Port. We recently stayed at the Spring Hill Marriott and we were pleased with this accommodation in the heart of the area. We had a larger king suite on the 6th floor, which was quiet, clean and provided ample necessities, adequate with a large bathroom. With all the extra space in the bathroom, shelving is definitely lacking, there is none. We had a view facing an office building, but that does not take away from the comfort of the room and it's always great to discover the views exploring the city anyway. The Keg Steakhouse practically next door on rue St-Paul is always delicious. The breakfast on the mezzanine was fine and the selections were plentiful and replenished. There are choices for everyone's taste and enough seating space. We found the moka coffee strong having to add at least five milk cups. The Spring Hill is a great choice with a helpful staff, reasonable AAA/CAA rates and in & out valet parking ($21 Cdn). We will definitely return and try the Spa services next time. Recommended ... don't think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a convenient Old Montreal location”
Reviews.Author: countFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends for two nights before taking a cruise from Montreal to Florida. The hotel is about 10 minutes from the central train station-a quick cab ride to a sheltered drop area built into and under the building itself. From there you enter a very modern functional lobby where cordial, helpful staff quickly checked us in and briefed us on the area. A half block down is Rue St. Paul, the main restaurant and bar street of Old Montreal where we had a delightful meal at a very reasonable cost. The room itself was very commodious and the shower and bed both 'above average'. The cost was reasonable, and included a lite buffet breakfast available on the mezzanine floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and what you would expect from SpringHill Suites”
Reviews.Author: Treva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SpringHill suites hotel for a couple nights while visiting Montreal. The hotel is situated right in the heart of Old Montreal. It is just a block away from the Main strip of St Paul Street where you can find various bars and restaurants. There is a really interesting bar around the corner called Le Piano Rouge. I didn't go in but there was quite a line up. It is also down the street from a Keg Steak house and a brew pub.It is also about 2 blocks from the water front. The accommodation are pretty standard SpringHill Suites with a small kitchen area, a couch and a large King sized bed. Flat screen TVs are in each room and a shower with a tub and a separate sink area. The breakfast was good though I didn't use the buffet, but it seemed like a nice spread and well worth the cost when you consider the room rates. Couple things to Note. If you stay on Saturday Night and are fortunate enough to find street parking, the meters only start working Sunday @ 1:00 PM . So parking on the street overnight can be done. During the week, the meters do turn back on @ 9:00 AM so it might be slightly more difficult. All in all , nice little spot and right in the middle of the beautiful old city. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Merci beaucoup”
Reviews.Author: Kristy31
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing 3-night stay at this hotel in the heart of old Montreal. Perfect location (not only walking distance to all the must-sees/restaurants/shops in Old Montreal but also easy 10-15 min drive to other tourist destinations and prime shopping areas). Staff were friendly, helpful and quick to respond to all of our requests. Room was clean and modern. Bathroom was spotless and large vanity area. Free valet parking (parking is not free = $21) and a free full hot breakfast buffet (eggs, yogurt, pastries, waffle station, fruit juice, .

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: Mesdmd
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was hardly a suite, Was very disappointed by furnishings, cleanliness, and amenities. I have stayed in many Marriott properties and this was one of the poorest. The only good thing was the location right in old town Montreal. We asked if we could upgrade to a real suite and we were told this was one of the larger rooms. This property is well below what I expect form Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: Doron53
Reviews.Content: great location,very helpfull staff, large rooms,and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: mootz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights here with friends and family (in their own rooms). I had requested a high floor and the king suite with balcony. Our room was on the fifth floor with a view of the office building across the street. The balcony was shared with the room next door and by our fourth night we could no longer access the balcony as the handle would not work. My husband reported this to the front desk the next morning, and by the time of our check out this was still not addressed. Overall, the suite was small. It's basically one room with a 3/4 wall to separate the location of the sofa and the bed. There's a desk and a counter with sink and small dorm size fridge and microwave. There's essentially enough space for two people, although six of us did manage to cram into the living area one afternoon by using the balcony chairs and promising not to move. The location is excellent, within walking distance to everything in Old Montreal. We did enjoy the valet parking and since we drove our crew around the city, it was easy to have the car brought to the front for each trip out. Breakfast is pretty good, too. Most days had scrambled eggs, bacon, ham, croissants, dry cereal and fruit. Some days had a tremendous number of guests and the tables were full, and other days were much quieter. We used the whirlpool and pool (very small but good for relaxing)a few times, and both were clean. I do have to agree with another writer with regard to assistance with luggage by the staff. At no point in time did anyone ask if we required assistance, which is unusual for the better chains, however, when we had questions on touring the city they were helpful. Old Montreal is quite the tourist trap with restaurants serving ok food and the shops being mostly tourist traps (too many souvenir shops). We would recommend going to Ste. Denis to see the real Montreal. Wonderful shops, restaurants (Rockaberry - best slice of apple pie) and overall view of life in the city. Driving in the city was much easier than expected, they do a terrific job of posting street signs at every intersection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: like2travel1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights here, as tourists, and everything was excellent. Our room with a king-size bed was on the back side of the 5th. floor, near the elevator, and we had a great view overlooking Old Montreal and the water. Our room included a sofa-bed, mini-refrigerator and microwave, and a work desk with both wired and wireless Internet access. The size of the room was slightly small but adequate for the two of us. Our room was very clean and very quiet. All of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The valet parking area is directly under the hotel and hotel elevator go directly to the parking levels, which made it easy for us to get things from our car as needed, rather than having to unload everything at check-in. The complimentary breakfast was excellent, with a variety of different hot items every day of our stay, plus two waffle irons. Utensils are real china and real silverware. Several attendants on duty kept everything quickly replenished and clean. Hot coffee and hot water for tea were available throughout the day. Located right in the heart of Old Montreal, there are many nice restaurants with cuisines of all types on Rue St. Paul, just a short walk from the hotel. We were extremely pleased wtih our decision to stay here and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: raymac812
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was a great choice. The hotel is tucked away on a little side streen, so it was a little difficult to find -- I would recommend a good GPS unit to anyone arriving by car. The room was large and spacious, and the bed comfortable. They have a small pool, whirlpool and workout room on the 1st. floor. Breakfast was included in the room price, and it was good. The location in Old Montreal (Vieux Montreal) was perfect - lots of restaurants, bars/music clubs and shopping in the area. My only complaint is that the hotel staff was very cold and indifferent -- not rude, just not interested. My husband and I arrived in the early evening, we pulled our car up to the front of the hotel and went to check in -- although there were 2 people working the front desk, niether asked if we needed help with the bags. We didn't need help, but it's generally standard (especially in a Marriot property) to offer. They were happy to valet the car, but again we had to ask about this. Another evening we stopped by the desk to ask a question. The person working the desk was helping another guest so we waited a good 5 minutes before walking away -- not once during that time did the desk clerk ever acknowleged our presence. The staff wasn't rude, but they weren't helpful either. That said, I would certainly recommend the hotel for it's location and general ammenties.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: dsgranny
Reviews.Content: A little hard to get to with the one way streets but fabulous area with fine dining right there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MichiganderMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights and the location to old town and down town is perfect---the staff was very friendly and helpful----the rooms were very nice and the little area with the frig and micro was very helpful---my only "con" with this place was the carpets were either dirty or just getting old---I kept my slippers on when we were in the room! The rest of the cleanliness of hotel was fine.The buffet breakfast was great with many choices and it was kept replenished.The sound insulation was terrific for we didn't hear any noises outside of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: skoc50
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night here, but it was the perfect selection for a one-night stay. We arrived late (around 7pm) and needed to go out to eat before it got too late. I had no idea how close we were to all the restaurants & shops on Rue St. Paul. It was literally a very short block. We were able to grab an outside table at a cafe and then walked around and were delighted to find entertainment going on in the streets. The room itself was typical SpringHill Suites style with a nice breakfast provided the next morning before we had to catch a train to Quebec City. I can't think of anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the Old City!”
Reviews.Author: ryacuzzo
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better. Tucked away on a small side-street, it is very quiet. Convenient to dozens of good restaurants and the waterfront as well as Historic Old Montreal. The young lady at the reception desk may have been the best ever. There is a good restaurant on premises, but a multitude of eateries close by as well. Breakfast was ample. Valet parking costs $20 for 24 hours. A/C a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: cookchicTN
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one night at this SpringHill Suites. While the rooms are a bit older, they have been recently updated and are very comfortable. I was very impressed with the hotel's restaurant (I only got to see it, not actually dine there) - but I would plan on going back to enjoy the great fire pits and ambiance. There are many great places to dine and relax nearby. I will defintely stay again and the only reasons for less than 5 star rating were difficulty in finding location and the smaller, older rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest suites ever”
Reviews.Author: JAGR32
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great location close to many restaurants and attractions. Only complaint is that these suites are small. When the sofa bed is open, it's impossible to get out the door. I wanted to work out in the fitness center while the kids were still sleeping, and had to climb over the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Bon Jour Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen12561
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this very nice hotel in August, 2011. The Staff was very helpful and the suite was excellent, and the breakfast............just fabulous! We chose the larger suite and paid a little more since there were 4 women sharing. It worked out very well as the bathroom sink is separate from the toilet and shower. The living area was very spacious. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A great city experience for kids!”
Reviews.Author: pasch1
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took her two children (aged 7 and 9) to Montreal for the first time this summer and stayed in the Old City, which was a great location. There are museums, shops and plenty of restaurants all within walking distance. We were so happy with our choice of hotel - Springhill Suites has an indoor pool, which the kids loved. In between sightseeing this gave them a fun thing to do while the adults rested their feet! The breakfast was another great feature - we expected coffee and a roll, but there is a full buffet with everything you could want. We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next visit to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: marsille
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the hotel's claim to have been "renovated" in 2009 seems a little off. I think it was more "freshened up" than renovated. That said, it's perfectly adequate and clean and comfortable. The breakfast is great, the location is ideal, and the beds are the great Marriott beds I have come to love. I think the carpet needs changing (though it's in decent shape) and the bathrooms could use a more thorough updating. That said, I do recommend the hotel and the rooms are plenty big enough for several adults. We had three in our room. Separate living/kitchenette area, and a nice flat screen tv.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Summertime1967
Reviews.Content: Our 4 day stay at this hotel was amazing. Our larger suite was perfect and the balcony was a really nice extra. Our kids aged 11 and 17 loved the hotel as well. The daily breakfast is fantastic, with a very nice selection of food. The location is absolutely perfect because it's so close to all the attractions in Old Montreal. All of the staff at this hotel are so friendly and helpful. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Convenient - Repeat visit”
Reviews.Author: Alex C
Reviews.Content: This is was our second time to this hotel in the past few years. It was a family vacation as we were moving our youngest into school at Mcgill. Once again, we were not disappointed. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful with directions and places to eat. The room was clean and comfortable and slept 4 of us (3 adults, 1 child) easily. The daily breakfast was great and definitely a money saver. The location of the hotel itself is great - border of Old Montreal and walking distance to lots of great restaurants, the water front and notre dam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Stormy92
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of five with teenagers. I thought the location was good, with the restaurants nearby together with the jet boats and museums. We weren't far from the centre either. The bedroom was spacious, with two double beds in a separate area to the tv and sofa bed. The beds would have been queen size if I had the choice! Breakfast was a good choice and you can make your own waffles which always goes down well with my family. Staff were helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Think Twice - Book It!”
Reviews.Author: sbrown61
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in this lovely Marriott hotel and could easily have stayed longer if time permitted. Strategically located near the centre of old Montreal it was perfect for my photography jaunts back and forth to my room several times daily. My arrival was swift and uneventful - just the way I like it even though it was Friday afternoon of a long weekend. GPS directions took me down the quaint side streets directly to the garage parking where the attendant swiftly tended to my car. As requested I was given a quiet room on the 5th floor away from the seemingly busy lower levels where families with children could enjoy the swimming pool facilities. I would recommend requesting the higher floors if this is something you're hoping for. Frankly, I couldn't believe how quiet it was given this boutique hotel's exceptional location in the middle of town. My room was amply spacious, clean, and equipped with amenities such as microwave and fridge which I took full advantage of. Steps away is a convenience store with everything you may need. The accommodations were both inviting and comfortable and could easily have been for a family or two couples. If you're looking for a fancy lobby bar and entertainment this is not the hotel for you. If however you want to be in the centre of action and go adventure outside for your amusement then this is it. Live music surrounds you be it in one of the wonderful French restaurants indoors or outside on one of the many patios (seasonal of course!). The Imax theatre (films in both English and French) and port activities are easily accessible within a few minutes jaunt. I had the opportunity to take in a river cruise while I was there in an open air vessel and it was on of the highlights of my vacation. Being a solo traveller I felt completely safe and at ease in this beautiful town. Don't hesitate booking this hotel for your trip be it single, couple or family. You will not be disappointed. I have full intentions of returning on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: justducky1960
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on a narrow side street and wasn't easy to find, but we were surprised how nice it was once we walked in. Valet parking was great (no parking lot or on-street parking), but cost $21/day plus tip. Our "suite" was small with no real divided space. King size bed was comfortable. Room was very clean except for the carpet that appeared to be stained. Our son slept on the sofa bed, which we couldn't walk around when it was opened. Desk, fridge, microwave in room. Decent breakfast was included. Computers and printer available to guests in the Business Center. A/C was very noisy. Pool was small and in the basement (not very inviting). Location of the hotel for visiting Old Montreal was great. A few attractions and lots of restaurants and shops were within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but will probably stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: emily311m
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room with a small patio with table and chairs. That was very nice and I would have liked to enjoy a beverage out there, but this hotel does not have a bar. As for the room, the carpets were stained in every part of the room. Everything else was okay, but for the price I paid I think I will stay elsewhere next time I'm in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JoPropht
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, comfortable room with frige and microwave, good matress and pillows. Breakfast was very average, go early to stay away from the rush... Plan on paying $21 per day for the parking. The location is wonderful if you want to experience the Europeen taste of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Buttery breakfast scrambled eggs and immaculate comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: flosser
Reviews.Content: The suites here provide a microwave, a small dorm size refrigerator, a comfortable couch, flat screen tv, extremely comfortable king bed and clean bathroom with mirror and sink outside the toilet and tub/shower area. We had the air conditioning set at 66, which maintained us at a comfortable 68 during the very hot and humid 4 nights of our visit. I wouldn't count on using the pool as it was cloudy, about the size of a minivan and unappealing but other areas such as the business area for internet use, were clean and convenient. We enjoyed the breakfast offerings and the mezanine location in an airy space with many seating options even high top tables of 8. We all raved about the buttery scrambled eggs-some one in the kitchen has that recipe down to a science! Also in the breakfast area, there was a flat screen TV over the fireplace where we were allowed to tune in the Red Sox game in the evening...nice meeting spot for the 3 couples we traveled with. The front desk staff was knowledgable and always helpful. Even the parking which was right alongside the hotel in a garage was pleasant and efficient. I found the rooms very soundproof and relaxing. The location was just a street away from vieux montreal and all it's charm and within walking to the waterfront area where we spent much of our time. While visiting we walked easily to Gibby's for dinner, to Schwartz the Musical, to Notre Dame, to Marche Bonsecours but never used the metro from this location?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/ Nice room”
Reviews.Author: riodoc
Reviews.Content: great spot for seeing Old Montreal- tough to find as it is on a little side street- be sure to get specific directions- my GPS couldn't quite figure it out!- Once there could walk to a multitude of fine places to shop, eat and see the sights- Very nice staff, room was very spacious and clean, parking was super convenient- breakfast was quite nice (awesome chocolate croissants! :)) but with the usual crowds and didn't have the most efficient layout for flow of people but staff did very best to accomodate- will definitely return-

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: getoutthere_Toronto
Reviews.Content: This was our second choice hotel and the only one we could find during Jazz Fest this year as we were late booking. What a great location - right in the middle of Old Montreal. Just around the corner from the Red Piano and the Keg. The rooms are spacious with a mini fridge for wine, sofa and a desk area. Wifi is no charge. Don't get too excited about the included breakfast. It is a bust! You have to get there when they first open or you will be going hungry. The "hot" food is not, the coffee is crappy and there is not nearly enough of anything to make a breakfast. Crappy breakfast aside - I would return but because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, spacious room!”
Reviews.Author: maggie_schaal
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Marriott Springhill Suites in Old Montreal while travelling to Quebec City. The location, in old Montreal, was perfect. We were able to walk to many restaurants and shops.The room was very spacious and very clean with a separate sitting area, kitchenette and desk. The staff at check-in were very helpful and efficient. The breakfast, which was included, was wonderful! Lots of fresh fruit, yogurt, cold cereals, oatmeal, several hot options (eggs, sausage, bacon, waffles) and several breads/pastries from which to choose. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Mayhem
Reviews.Content: This property is tucked among the historic buildings of Old Montreal but is pleasantly contemporary in its accommodations and services per usual SpringHill standards. The recently renovated rooms are sleek and clean. Ours was larger in size with separate sleeping area and large outdoor terrace with cafe tables and chairs shared with two other rooms though we never saw anyone else out there. Simple planters divide the otherwise continuous outdoor space. The building itself does not appear to be historic although the lobby connects to one of the districts oldest restaurants whose main entrance is located on the street behind. More than adequate breakfast is served on the second floor mezzanine. The hotel is located on a very quiet street--more like an alley--whereas many old town streets can be loud and disruptive especially during the summer tourist season. We rarely took our car out of the on site parking garage walking to most attractions including the Montreal Jazzfest.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but ordinary for the price”
Reviews.Author: Amen9
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right near all the sights in old town Montreal. But pretty ordinary..nothing at all special. Small, crowded lobby and breakfast room was a zoo. Was clean and service was OK too, but a bit slow and no concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Johnmalroy
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife , we stayed at the hotel for 3 nights at one of the suites , the location of the hotel is great , you can really experience the old town , the vibe , the small streets , the european vibe is incrediblle.As of the hotel , the lobby and the mezzanine floor are beautiful , the rooms need some re-decoration as they are a bit old dated , but still good. I red a lot of reviews , with people complaining about the AC's , but by the time we were there , they were changing all of the ac's our also , and its quiet and very cosy.i should say that the night staff are incrediblle , the fornt desk was very helpfull , with all our needs , as well as the young man doing the service in the night.we had a toilet problem for which he took care almost instantly , we asked for some more glasses and yowels , he brought them fast , was effitient and very polite .the brekfast was good , normal buffet , of course the people take care of it did a great job with the cleaning and with only fresh food served.Next we vidit , we will stay again here for sure , with that pleasant atmosphere and great location , it leaves you at the end only with a great memory for spendying your time at montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Hotel for Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Rick S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in a large suite that included a roof top patio. We really liked both the hotel and the location. A couple of other reviews found the rooms to have dated decor but that wasn't our experience. The room was clean and attractive and very spacious. We had a plumbing problem that the hotel took care of almost instantly; could not have asked better service. The hotel was very busy which just reinforced my impression of the breakfast staff - they did an amazing job of restocking food and keeping the tables clean. This might have been the most attentive breakfast staff I have ever seen. I agree with a previous reviewer that the pool is small. That said, I used it and got as much excercise as I usually do. It might not, however, be attractive for someone who really likes to swim laps or a family with several children who are lookng forward to a pool. There is a lot to do in Montreal and the Old Town locaton is the center of much of it. It has an old world "foreign" feel but is close to the US and easy to negotiate. French is spoken, but English was always spoken when needed. If you haven't been there you should go!

Reviews.Title: “Just adequate”
Reviews.Author: Barfly-guy
Reviews.Content: Many posters rate this hotel highly because of its excellent location. But it is really just a 3 star hotel. On the positive side, it is clean, the valet service is efficient, and it includes a fridge, wi-fi and a buffet breakfast. But the rooms are poorly appointed with a huge divider that makes the room feel very cramped and dark. All they did was take a room, put in a divider and call it a suite. The balconies just provide a view of the back alley. And the buffet breakfast was terrible. As for the pool, I don't think you could fit more than three people in it at a time. Yes, the location is perfect, but there are many boutique hotels in the area which will provide you with a real old Montreal experience. Pass on this one unless you get a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: hallake2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away on a side street steps away from Rue Saint-Paul and all the charm and entertainment of Old Montreal. The rooms are well-appointed and quite roomy. We slept a family of 4 in comfort. All the conveniences of a newer hotel in the old part of the city. Breakfast is nicely done - something for everyone. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: mittmott
Reviews.Content: I don't get the raves for this place... yes it is clean, and yes the location is good, you are in the old town. The rooms are in terrible need of an update. Very dated. Old stained carpet, old fashioned counter topped sink outside of toilet area, yuch, you have to come out to wash your hands. The only thing modern about this place was the flat screen tv. In it's defense, as I said clean. A big let down, after just spending a few nights at the courtyard by marriot in old quebec. That was such a beautiful place, and the staff there was outstanding, getting to know their guests. Here I walked back in, and not even a hello. Again, not a terrible place, but nothing special at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pentangle
Reviews.Content: Great location in Old Montreal. It is European style hotel. Small but very well appointed rooms. Does not look or feel like a chain hotel. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location; More like a boutique than a chain!”
Reviews.Author: TravelSavvyMomAZ
Reviews.Content: I will start with the minor disadvantage of this hotel: The rooms were a little outdated and could be spruced up to match the boutique feel of the lobby and mezzanine. All the advantages outweigh this decorating drawback. The location is fantastic if you're wanting Old Montreal. The hotel is on a side street from the pedestrian-friendly Rue St. Paul. Therefore, we heard very little traffic noise from our hotel, and we were able to walk everywhere in the Old neighborhood. (We kept our car valet-parked the entire stay; rate was $21CAD, which was reasonable for an area with very little parking.) The hotel staff was very friendly and offered wonderful family-friendly suggestions for dining and activities. The old staircase was beautiful and led up to a dining area for complimentary breakfast--a huge variety of great-tasting hot and cold items. There was also a complimentary business room with several computers for quick internet access. Our upgraded double room was huge and had a bathroom configuration that separated the living from the sleeping space, so it almost seemed like two separate rooms (most SpringHill Suites just have a half-wall divider between the sleeping and lounging areas). Also, the sink/vanity was outside of the bath/toilet area, which was convenient for our family. The room was also clean with comfortable (though bland) bedding. This hotel had a European feel, which provided an unexpected touch to the reliable family-friendly SpringHill Suites chain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location - Love this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mblodgett
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because I am a great fan of all the Marriott hotels. We wanted to visit Old Montreal and SpringHill Suites was a perfect choice. The room was very spacious. It had a fridge, microwave, coffee pot, and the usual - Nice comfy bed! Maid service was swift & fantastic. Hotel reservation / check in desk folks were very nice. They were very helpful with all sorts of info on the area. The hotel is one block from Rue St. Paul which is a "blocked off" street......so we could stroll and enjoy a gelato or dine in all sorts of out door restaurants. This is a congested area, but the hotel offers valet parking. We were so close to everything we never used our car. LOVED IT. We would go back again & definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, wonderful accommodations, great price”
Reviews.Author: paul-delaware
Reviews.Content: We spent parts of four days and three nights here and you cannot beat this location. Right in the middle of Old Montreal, you can almost roll out of bed and onto a cobblestone street and into many fantastic shops and restaurants. You're just a block and a half from Notre Dame and a few blocks from Chinatown. It's an easy walk to the subway, which can get you downtown or to places like the Biodome in minutes. The service was exceptional, the rooms were clean and modern, the price was more-than-fair, and the breakfast buffet was as good as something you'd get in a restaurant. We'd stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - a couple of niggles”
Reviews.Author: instinkt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a break in Canada. Picked the hotel due to location and wasn't disappointed - perfect for looking around Old Montreal. Room was OK - felt a little cramped. The main issue we had was the air conditioning unit that was very noisy and very ineffective. Stopped us sleeping on a couple of nights. Breakfast was OK (typically fare for the class of hotel) and we made use of the small exercise room. Enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel for location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the Old Montreal area”
Reviews.Author: OttawaAli
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here in late January to enjoy some of Montrealâ€™s winter activities. The hotel is tucked away down a narrow street, but very close to the many shops and restaurants of the old Montreal area (itâ€™s about 5 minutes from Chinatown and about 10 minutes from the Place Dâ€™Armes metro stop). The room was a nice size, had a small kitchenette area, desk with chair, small sofa and a good sized bathroom area. The main part of the room had a large TV and the room was clean and comfortable. Service was great at check-in and check-out with staff being very friendly and helpful. The only downsides were that my room looked out onto the roof-top area at the back of the hotel, so there wasnâ€™t any view as such and the walls were relatively thin especially out onto the corridor which meant you could hear people talking out there (a hockey team was staying on my floor and their late night chats in the corridor made sleeping difficult â€“ their early morning wake up wasnâ€™t great either!). However the bed was very comfy and Iâ€™d recommend staying here again, especially if you can find a cheap deal. The free breakfast buffet in the morning had a nice selection, the area got very busy and crowded making finding a seat difficult, but the option of take away containers was a good touch so food could be taken back to your room. The swimming pool, Jacuzzi and gym were located on the 2nd floor and were very good. The pool was small, not the type of pool you could swim around in, but ideal for taking a relaxing dip. Bad points â€“ Some rooms have limited views. Thin walls and doors means it can be noisy depending on other guests. Good points â€“ Good location for the Old town, lots of restaurants close by. Microwave, fridge and sink in room are very handy. Breakfast buffet has nice selection and is included free. Indoor swimming pool and Jacuzzi although small provide a nice way to relax. Free Wi-Fi in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for cruise ship travelors”
Reviews.Author: Denver52
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled for a cruise from Montreal and found this hotel to be very convenient within walking distance to the port. The hotel is clean, quiet and close to interesting things to see and do in Montreal. The breakfast was good and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location & friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Fireinthehole07
Reviews.Content: Nice location, great restaurants all around the hotel. Feel of Europe, safe walking around the area. Nice breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility with super staff”
Reviews.Author: uofa_fastpitch_lover
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed here for three nights and recommend this hotel whole-heartedly. Our room was spacious, clean, well-maintained, and comfortable. The friendly, bilingual staff at the front-desk were highly knowledgeable and unfailingly helpful. The breakfast buffet was a cut above typical hotel-breakfast fare. The hotel is located around the corner from the busy rue St. Paul and so is a bit shielded from noise while still convenient to shops and restaurants. The only caution to note is the hotel's very close proximity to an office building next door; opening the curtains brought us practically face-to-face with the workers there. The hotel is a five- to ten-minute walk to the Place d'Armes Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: littledutchgirl74
Reviews.Content: I stayed only ONE night in this hotel with my Mother and my 2 young daughters, but it will now be the only hotel I stay in while in Montreal. It is so reasonably priced for how lovely it is! The foyer and mezzanine levels are just beautiful. Beds were comfy and clean. (nice mattress cover). Bathroom was plain, but otherwise room decor was very updated and well done. This hotel is RIGHT in the middle of Old Montreal. We could walk everywhere. Fabulous. The room was huge! Two double beds AND a sofa. Kitchenette was very handy. (Bring microwave popcorn, families!) Breakfast was terrific too! Staff was constantly taking empty plates, and tidying. Couldn't believe it was free! But the most amazing thing was that my young daughter forgot her 'blankie' in the room after we had checked out. It wasn't till we were home in Ottawa that we realized it had been forgotten. It's a torn up, white bit of fabric, but she's never slept without it, and she was despondent! I called the hotel and spoke to housekeeping. The woman knew exactly what I was referring to. She explained that they are all Moms, and as soon as they saw this torn up fabric under the sheets, they KNEW it was a special blankie! The housekeeper took it to her manager and said "Keep an eye on this, it's special. I'll bet someone will be calling" That was special enough, but they then mailed it back to us (we live in Ottawa) for FREE the same day. My only critique was that the pool was tiny, so we didn't even bother. But with so much to do and see all around you, we didn't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Mod Cons in Old City”
Reviews.Author: Peregrina651
Reviews.Content: Marriott Suite Hotels have spoiled me for life! This is our third visit to a Marriott suite hotel since January and every single one of them has been sparkling clean and friendly. We are in a larger suite on the 6th floor with views in two directions. The rooms have been recently refurbished and it is quiet up here. The larger suite offers a separate sleeping area along with a sitting room--with its own TV--and mini kitchen. The bathroom is spacious--and meticulously clean! Breakfast is included and in-room wi-fi is free. The kitchen includes micro, mini-fridge, coffeemaker and sink and is supplied with a couple of paper-plates and plastic utensils. As someone already mentioned, the hotel is down a small side street. However, it is very easy to find since it is just off of rue de Notre-Dame, directly in front of the Palais du Justice. The street is well marked if you are traveling west bound and you cannot see a sign for the hotel as you turn in. You will just have to trust us that it is there, on your left. Pull into the first driveway and then either into the garage or down to the main entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Old Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: ejm3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business March 2011. Luckily I was traveling with other people who knew where the place was because I'm not sure how you would find it without a very good GPS. It was a nice hotel and the room was very clean though kind of small. Room was very quiet (I was on the 6th floor). Lobby was nice but pretty small. Staff was helpful though things went smoothly so I didn't need them or much beyond check-in / check-out and some directions. Breakfast was just ok but included in my $149/night rate. Valet parking was $20/day. Overall if you're looking for a place to stay in Old Montreal this is a pretty good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room away from the parking garage...”
Reviews.Author: jeff-from-hamilton
Reviews.Content: Great hotel other than the noise from the parking garage. Friendly staff, nice rooms, breakfast was included and better than expected, GREAT location. BUT, make sure your room is not near or right above the parking garage. The noise from the garage door opening and closing was very loud and disturbing. That said, I'd definitely stay here again and simply ask for a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Lenny777
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and two of our daughters (12 & 14) for a long weekend getaway to Old Montreal. From the time of our arrival to the day of our departure the overall quality of service was truly outstanding. The Front Desk staff were friendly, accommodating, helpful and knowledgeable. The location is perfectly situated within Old Montreal and it is only a short walk to excellent restaurants, Bistros, shopping, and artsy boutiques. The Metro Station is only a 10 minute walk away, and from there you can travel to anywhere in the city. After one long day of shopping in downtown Montreal, we hailed a taxicab back to the hotel and it only cost us $8.00 plus a tip. The hot & cold buffet breakfast in the morning was plentiful and above average in quality; and the staff works diligently to make sure that there is always enough food for everyone. For our first night we had the King bed and pull-out sofa, but we found the room a little cramped with our two daughters and all their "stuff". We requested to move into the more spacious rooms that have two double beds and a sofa, and the excellent staff at the Front Desk made the change at no extra charge. That room was perfect for us and I highly recommend it if you are travelling with two kids. But if you are only a couple then go for the King, that bed was huge and wonderfully comfortable. The room with the double beds provided the extra space we needed and the beds were also extremely comfortable. All-in-all, it was an absolutely wonderful weekend stay and I would highly recommend this hotel as one of the very best choices in the city of Montreal. Would return again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “It was a jem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: lshorting
Reviews.Content: Had never been to Montreal before and checked the reviews for this hotel and they where all great. Now I know why. The rooms were adequate in size a king bed, couch, desk and a small fridge and microwave. The hotel served breakfast everyday which was eggs, bacon and homemade waffles all the pastries, coffee, juice you wanted. This was a great savings for us because we didn't have to have lunch because of the great breakfast. The hotel had coffee, tea available for guests all day which was a nice touch. We would walk around old Montreal and come back for a tea and too warm up.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: roselynnbelle
Reviews.Content: My family and I like to travel for leisurely sight seeing trips. We usually stay in mid priced hotels. This is by far the cleanest hotel we have stayed at recently. This makes for a much more pleasant experience for all of us because I am happy :). We enjoyed a god nights sleep in a comfortable bed and the refrigerator in the room is a plus. The breakfast wasnt anything great, but there were plenty of choices and the staff was friendly and made sure the area was kept clean and full.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Montreal with young children”
Reviews.Author: Liz-Mikko
Reviews.Content: My family had the pleasure of staying at the Marriott Spring Hill Old Montreal this past July as one of the 2 bookends of our trip to northern Vermont. The hotel had a nice welcome pack for the kids including a plastic turtle which still gets used at bath time today! The Spring Hill room was spacious, something not expected in Old Town, and comfortable for the 4 of us. We also had a balcony room which I do not recommend since it's more of a rooftop patio. It's shared with other rooms and other guests can walk by your windows which is not very private. Also the view from the patio is nothing scenic. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. Overall it was a very enjoyable stay and would look to stay here again the next time I'm in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: MaineJane2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we were looking for. Prefect location in old Montreal. Quiet, yet within easy walking distance of museums, historic sites, restaurants, shops and subway. Pleasant, professional staff. Breakfast buffet was good but not the best I've ever had. Wide variety of food choices. Breakfast room was crowded on the weekend but we always found a table. Pool, hot tub and fitness center were all small but we had them to yourselves every time we went there. Restaurant & room service were expensive but we didn't use either because there were many good restaurants nearby and our suite had a microwave and refrigerator. The hotel charges $20 per night for valet parking but all the hotels in this area charge the same. Hotel is a little tricky to find in the dark. I recommend arriving in daylight if possible. If we visit Montreal again, we will stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: shiftless
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Springhill Suites in med-November and were very pleased with our choice. The hotel is only 5 minutes' walk from the Palais des CongrÃ¨s where our conference was being held. In the other direction (towards the old port) there are lots of restaurants within a 4-5 block stretch on Rue Saint Paul. The room itself had a bathroom separate from the sink which was handy, access to a terrace and a comfy king-size bed. It was a bit too chilly to sit on the terrace, but this would be pleasant in summer (although there isn't much of a view). The complimentary hot buffet breakfast was a pleasant surprise after the continental breakfasts we had come to expect. The free wireless internet worked well. There's a depanneur just down the street for picking up a bottle of wine or a few beers and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: dp54
Reviews.Content: We travel extensively, much of it outside the USA. We look for value and high standards in accomodations. Four of us stayed here for three nights in mid-November 2010, on vacation. Superb management and an exceptionally competent, multi-lingual staff highlight this property. Check-in was quick and efficient. Our on-duty manager indicated the staff was ready to help in any way, including directions or restaurant recommendations. We felt very welcome from the moment we arrived. Springhill Suites are on a quiet side street in Old Montreal within a couple minutes walk to all the fine sites of Old Montreal. The location is safe and quiet. We had a King and two Double rooms. All were large, looked newly renovated, and were very clean. The suite is well designed so that the desk area and couch, along with mini-kitchen containing a sink, small fridge and microwave are placed apart from the sleeping area for some privacy. In-wall air conditioning/heating units were quiet and worked fine. Windows in our rooms could be opened to vent the rooms and allow in air at night. Coffee makers and hair dryers were in each room. Free WiFi is available in every room and throughout the facility. We made extensive use of this and found it worked perfectly. A 32-inch widescreen flat LCD TV was in the sleeping area. The beds and linens were comfortable and first-rate. The bathroom with sink, tub/shower and toilet were very clean and well designed. A complementary breakfast is served on a Mezzanine floor level above the check-in area. This breakfast is a cut above what we normally find in this type hotel. Eggs, ham/bacon, cheese, waffles, bagels, excellent breakfast muffins of many types, and many types of breads were served each morning. We appreciated that coffee and tea were available 24-hours a day in the breakfast room. We used this area for midday stops to have coffee and regroup. I must also mention the attached restaurant and bar. While not owned by Marriott, you enter it from the main lobby through a portal. It is the most eclectric, interesting design. Have a look, even if you don't eat here. It's like nothing you've seen in a hotel at this price point. It is pricey but worth checking out. We will stay here anytime we are in Montreal. The hotel is maintained to a very high standard and the staff are incredibly helpful. The taxi we reserved at the front desk a day prior to our departure was outside and waiting to take us to the airport on the morning we left. These are all signs of exceptional management and attention to detail. You won't go wrong booking here. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Ibn_Shisha
Reviews.Content: Our second stop on our summer trip through SE Canada. The Springhill Suites is in the heart of Old Montreal - a great value in a fantastic location. All the usual Springhill amenities, coupled with being right in the middle of the old town. The breakfast was disappointing, but there are many other options located nearby. As for dinner, the hotel is connected to Le St-Gabriel, a fantastic restaurant that was one our favorite experiences on the trip. Only downside other than breakfast - the valet service could be pretty darn slow sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to take in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Invictus_33
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the Springhill Suites Old Montreal and knowing Montreal very well, I was pleased with the location of the hotel in Old Montreal. Although locating the hotel can be a little tricky, once you exit the building, you are close to restaurants, shopping and the overall atmosphere of Old Montreal. I was able to use my CCA discount to get free parking (which is normally 20$ overnight - and only Valet service available) as well as a 25$ Gas Card. The room itself (extended King Suite) was located on the 3rd floor. Unfortunetly, only a select few rooms have a view from their windows. In my case, I overlooked the courtyard above the pool. The room itself offered a small kitchinette (mini fridge, sink), a work area, (desk) as well as a living room (pull out couch) with a 32inch flatscreen tv. There is an average bathroom (single sink, tub/showerhead, ect). Nothing special there. The bedroom itself offered a king size bed, and another tv in the corner of the room. Please note, if you want privacy between the bedroom and the living area, you won't find it here. A hallway connects the living room to the bathroom leading to the bedroom. The room does flow nicely, however it really didn't have anything special to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, & Service”
Reviews.Author: goodnorthern
Reviews.Content: Excellent and affordable choice in Old Town Montreal----Pros: location! No need to get in your car. Superb front desk staff, great with directions & recommendations. Recently upgraded rooms and ambiance. Wonderful value for a suite hotel, able to splurge on upgrades. Cons: breakfast was crazy, food had run out, too small of area to serve everyone, we ate somewhere else both days. Housekeeping not quite up to par: left bathroom partially dirty and did not restock used products. Bar in hotel closed to public on Saturday night due to private party. Quiet though, pool/spa are small but OK. Great value and would stay here again. Used the Cars Eat Free program for free parking & gas card.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comfort/Charming Setting/Convenient Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Hanschen
Reviews.Content: Old Montreal can look dusty and creepy, but this Marriott sparkles in every way. Front counter staff personnel can give expert directions; handle money matters, suggest restaurants, and all effectively. My only "knock" is that the coin laundry room is too small and needs additional washers and dryers. The "for free" breakfast is both generous and with high quality breakfast items. There are many starred restaurants close by. The parking garage is also in the same building and has swift car jockeys.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here If Vieux Montreal Is Your Destination”
Reviews.Author: jim9013
Reviews.Content: I don't write many reviews, but when I do it is for extreme praise or criticism. In the case of Marriott's SpringHill in Old Montreal, it is to share a very pleasurable experience. All things considered: price, location, condition of room, cleanliness, quietness...you really can't beat this place. Not all the amenities of a four/five star hotel, so if fancy lobbies, 24 hr room service and full service are what you seek you will not find those here. What you will find is a quiet, centrally located, clean and reasonably comfortable room in the middle of Old Montreal. Full breakfast buffet as well. Parking has in/out feature as well, also quite handy for touring outside the old city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: djazzie
Reviews.Content: The check in was quick and efficient, the provided us with jazz festival information and city information. The room was very spacious, a lot of light and a nice bathroom. -The very small pool was nice to relax a bit, but i think nobody would miss it when it was not there. -Free breakfast is nice tough there was almost no healthy choice. Waffles, bagels, sweet things for on the bread, machine juice, no large choice of fruit. To bad for European travelers which are not used to it those kind of things in the morning. Except this thing this hotel is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: ecp88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend with my husband. Great location right in the heart of Old Montreal, easy walk to lots of shops/restaurants and the water, also quick was to Metro stop. Breakfast was average, located in a small mezzanine so a bit crowded. Free wifi and also a free business center if you don't bring a laptop but need the internet. Room was fine, clean and average. We had a gift certificate so I can't comment on the value, but overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, well located for tourist”
Reviews.Author: lgt190
Reviews.Content: Stayed in late September 2010. Good location in Old Montreal. A little hard to find on a side street, but this makes it very quiet. Hotel set up as a business hotel. Very good complimentary breakfast. Allow at 15 -20 minutes to retrieve car from valet. Many restaurants and cafes withing walking distance. No in house bar but several fairly close. Felt safe walking at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: melinmelb_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Mariott SpringHills Suites on 21/09/2010. The service was excellent. We checked in at 8 in the morning, and the room was ready for us (it was so great as we had the overnight drive from Toronto). The location is perfect, walking ditance to NotreDame, St Paul, and a lot of tourist attractions. a lot of restaurants are closed by. The room itself is spacious, with 2 full bed, separate working desk, and equipped with microwave, and fridge. and free internet connections on the room (Not all the hotels do this) The parking is not including in the room rate, but they are so helpful, they will bring up your car in few minutes, and if you ask about the way or any tourist attractions, they are so keen to help. Breakfast was good and fresh, with a lot of choices for fussy eaters. Overall, this is an excellent hotel and very reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Luckyfour
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Marriott. As everyone says, the location is excellent and the staff frirendly. A little tip: if you have contact with the 1-800 number, they will contact the hotel with the general feedback but if you have very specific needs, contact the hotel directly. Given that, the hotel was extremely accomodating and we ended up being upgraded to a huge suite with windows that opened, a separate living room and patio. It was just great. We found it quiet and relaxing. Got a really good sleep. Nice to have the fridge (we like to buy milk for our coffee rather than dairy substitute) and they have a little area by the reception you can buy a few items. Due to over-walking, I could hardly move when I got back to the hotel. I had a fabulous massage that worked miracles. I would stay there again, especially in that wonderful room we had.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: guej
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 children (8 and 11) and I stayed here for 3 days at the end of August. We booked a bit late and could not get a room at one of the older known hotels (Les Armes or Auberge de Ville). In hindsight, it couldn't have worked out better. The Marriott was perfectly situated in Old Montreal in the middle of everywhere we wanted to go. I would definitely book here next time, and I hope there will be a next time. We loved Montreal. We got a room with 2 full beds and a sofa. It was going to be a little tight for the 4 of us....until I realized the sofa pulled out into a bed. What joy! Basically 3 beds between the 4 of us. That extra space of having a sofa was great for the kids to hang out on at night and watch TV while my husband and I read over in the other area of the room. There was a very large desk where we parked our laptop and maps, etc. The room also had a nice size fridge, sink and microwave. The bathroom was fine, with a sink and mirror outside of the door, which always works out well so more than 1 person can get ready at a time. Breakfast was included and was very good. Everything from fresh waffles to cereal to muffins to eggs, etc. They would leave styrofoam cups and containers so that guests could take breakfast back to their rooms. It was a great way to start each day before heading out. Breakfast was served until 10, which worked out well for my travel-weary family. The staff was very friendly and spoke English. Parking is right at the hotel. My husband pulled in to drop us off so we could check in, and then he parked the car. We didn't need it again until we left, and then we called the front desk and they had it ready for us in 5 minutes. I rarely give a hotel 5 stars, but I thought it was as good as it gets for what I paid ( I got a great deal on a last minute travel website). My only complaint was that there were no dark drapes on the windows. Only sheer curtains. It was really odd. Not only was it somewhat bright in the room when you went to sleep, but there was an office building very close and facing my room, so we had to get changed in the bathroom. Just a heads up. You may want to bring one of those sleep masks in case the room isn't dark enough for you. I don't know if this is the case with all the rooms, but it was with ours. Also, no bed bugs to our knowledge, and I had my husband do a good check of everything before we settled in.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable location; great stay”
Reviews.Author: Woodsiders5
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five - two adults, a four year old and two children under two. We stayed in the Marriott Springhill Suites in mid-August in one of the larger suite, 2 double and sofa bed. We had a terrific stay from beginning to end. We arrived very early (before noon) and our room was ready - an excellent start to the trip. Unloading the minivan, I managed to misplace a shoe belonging to one of our toddlers and the garage attendant spotted my husband later that day and offered the shoe that he had found under the van! We requested a pack and play for the youngest and was delighted to find that this hotel had a removable (i.e. could be cleaned and sterilized) wrap for the P&P that covered the whole thing!
