I am a nut and carried my own crib sheets but was delighted that my son was not peering through unclean netting. The Hotel is in the heart of Old Montreal, just a short stroll to the piers. We walked all over the place and found it all very doable. Montreal is a beautiful, clean and friendly city and we loved it and would recommend it to one and all. Two things I would note for our return trip to the hotel are to avoid the backroom for breakfast (it is a lonely conference room, meant for a spillover crowd from the ample breakfast and a bother to get to, especially with children); and there are meant to be two TVs in the larger suites. We only had one TV and a second would have been helpful for both adults and kids during wind down time in the evenings. Thanks to Trip Advisor for the area experts who were invaluable in our planning and made our trip even more of a success.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LadnerDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for a business meeting. The hotel is in a great location in Old Montreal, just steps to the main tourist street (St Paul). The room I stayed in was not a suite per say but a large room with 2 queen beds. The bed was comfortable, got to sleep relatively easily despite a 3 hour time change for me. Went for a run the first morning and then used the exercise equipment. The exercise room is small (two treadmills, one elliptical and a bench with some dumbbells), but the equipment was newer and in good working order. I enjoyed the breakfasts that they provided.

Reviews.Title: “Cant fault a thing !!”
Reviews.Author: MLSBordeaux
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our two single night stays in this hotel - location perfect close to Old Town Montreal, service, facilities, room with kitchen facilities etc etc all excellent..

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, but not convenient as I would wish”
Reviews.Author: MyleenAustin
Reviews.Content: We were here only 1 night, so take that into consideration when reading this review. We arrived in the evening to catch the fireworks festival. I thought the rooms were clean enough and it was good that there was a fridge and microwave in the room. However, there are hardly any services for the leisure traveler. There is no spa or room service available. Breakfast can't even be ordered to your room. Also, there is no one to help you with your luggage. So, don't expect it from this hotel! This is basically a 3 star hotel in a central location. It is true that the location is right in Old Montreal a block away from Saint Paul street where many restaurants and tourist shops are, but the hotel is kind of tucked away on a charmless street which sort of looks like a dark alley, The turn is easy to miss, so make sure you have a good GPS turned on! But, Montreal is a very safe city and we felt comfortable in this area. Also, almost ALL the restaurants around this area close around 10 or 11pm on the weekends, so if you want to go out for late dining or just need a snack in the middle of the night, you're fresh out of luck as the room service is non-existant. There is ONE bar that is open until 2am around the corner and has snacks available until 12:30am which we luckily found after our fireworks festival. I wouldn't stay around this area if you want to party to the wee hours. I think that most people who stay here are early risers to take advantage of Old Montreal sightseeing. The metro is about 5 or 6 blocks away or a 7-10 minute walk, but it is a bit hilly around this area, so you may find it strenuous if you're out of shape. We did not get to use any of the fitness facilities or pool, so can't comment on that. I believe the Internet was free, but not wireless. You would have to basically use the ethernet cable in the room. Also, breakfast is free but CROWDED in the summer/tourist season. Make sure you give yourself an hour to eat or go early because you may have to wait for a place to sit. I suppose you can bring the food to your room, but there is no table really to sit at in your room, except for a small side table. You must pay for parking in their parking garage, which they will valet for you. It's pretty expensive, but you will find you'll have to since Montreal is very European in that you have to walk everywhere or take the Metro around town. No parking lots at every place you go to like in the U.S. burbs :-). Overall, it's a good, basic hotel with no frills or luxuries and close to all that you want to see in Old Montreal. Just make sure you bring your own snacks/drinks that you may need at all hours of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Old Montreal Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelswith5
Reviews.Content: While we did have some minor maintenance issues with the room (bathroom door lock not working), the hotel was tremendous. The staff was very patient with questions from many guests about local events and activities. The switched from French to English effortlessly and without any hesitation to satisfy the guest. I was really impressed and pleased with this property and the staff. It is literally one half block from the cobblestone streets filled with restaurants, shops and nightlife. And another block after that to the old waterfront which is also filled with fun things to do. Recommended for families with kids. Breakfast in the hotel to start the day helps with kids, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and comfort of a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Savvy_Traveler85
Reviews.Content: The Springhill is tucked away in a little alley, right by Rue St. Paul which is the main tourist area of Vieux Montreal. It is comfortable and well maintained...a few rooms had balconies (fabulous) and it has a small pool, which was a lifesaver since it was very hot while we were in Montreal. It was full of American families and a school group or two...breakfast was good, but the scene was crowded and a bit overwhelming compared to other Springhills where we've stayed. We had a great time...

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: JuneinParis
Reviews.Content: My family and I (husband & 3 children- 20, 18 and 9) stayed here briefly during July 2010 and I could not of made a better choice, especially for the price! The staff is excellent ... professional, extremely helpful and full of information that will make your trip that much better. The hotel itself is nice and very clean..... nothing elaborate and fairly typical. The rooms are very spacious, the beds and pull-out couch comfortable and the wi-fi speedy and FREE. The kitchenette is a plus for anyone traveling with kids. Breakfast is standard continental fare ... the coffee is very good and the croissants delicious. There is a parking garage located right beside the hotel but whether this is just for the valet I'm not sure.... once we left our car we did not use it again until we left. The absolute best part of this hotel however is it's LOCATION. Exit the hotel and make a left and not 30 feet away is Rue St. Paul. This avenue is a/the hub of activity, especially at night and lined with your choice of shops, restaurants and cafes. It is incredibly central and within walking distance to just about everything you may want to see and do in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mkkkfamily
Reviews.Content: I am in one of their 4 suites tonight - we're sorry our plans are to leave tomorrow - great suite with 2 beds and a separate room with sleeper sofa and another tv - also a kitchenette and desk. But the best part is the location - can't imagine staying anywhere else when in Montreal for pleasure. We are very happy with our choice of hotels - cannot say the same about the 1st restaurant we attempted to eat in (La Maree), but that's another story!

Reviews.Title: “Springhill Suites Vieux Montreal”
Reviews.Author: HammerNJ
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel - well run, perfect location. Try to book a room on the 5th floor where there are Balconies. The lobby back up to a great Restaurant/Bar (Auberge St. Gabriel) but all the great things to see and do are less than a 5 minute walk away. The Manager/Staff of the Hotel are terrific, could not do enough to keep us happy, moved us to a Balcony room the 2nd night. Love this place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Seismo_mid
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in mid June. Our room was always clean and everything worked well. The Breakfasts were good with scrambled eggs, sausage or ham, waffles and a good selection of cereals and breads. Be advised that the internet is with a cable connection only at this time. A cable is provided. The rooms are spacious. We would have wished for a larger bathroom counter area. The location is only a block off of St Paul, so you are walking distance to most if not all of old Montreal. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near cruise terminal”
Reviews.Author: G8R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights before embarking on a Holland America cruise to Boston. The location was a pleasant walk away from the cruise terminal, and only a block away from the riverside park. The old charming buildings in Old Montreal are very picturesque. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, and, to my relief, spoke both English and French. They have free internet service available on the two computers in the business center, but the French language keyboard had some symbols in different locations than I than I am used to, and they were frustratingly slow. But I was happy to be able to check email for free. Our room was plain, and the lighting was inadequate, but we had a small sofa, desk area, sink, and refrigerator. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice ammenties”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Sch
Reviews.Content: Our family loved this hotel, although there were a few faults. The location is great in Old Montreal, and families love the pool area. There is great running and biking along the Old Port, and the staff here was very friendly too. Our complaints relate mostly to air conditioning. We were there on an unusually hot weekend for May, and we had a top floor room. This combination overwhelmed the A/C, and it would only work for a few minutes at a time. The maintenance man was unable to fix the issue, and we were given $20 for our trouble. However, I would have preferred working A/C over the $20 rate reduction. The other issue was that we reserved a room with a balcony, but weren't given one. By the time we remembered our balcony request, we had partially unpacked and decided it wasn't work making an issue over. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very few faults”
Reviews.Author: the-rach
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in April, and only paid for two thanks to a deal through Expedia. So we were off to a good start! The hotel is very modern and nicely presented. Our room was clean and comfortable. Although, the layout of the room was a little odd and it was smaller than we expected, having booked a suite. However, we didn't use the fold out sofa or kitchenette, so it wasn't a problem for us. We had no view from the window, but we didn't mind. The location is really good - in old Montreal which is lovely. It is quite easy to walk to Downtown, or to the subway to go further afield. Chinatown is also close enough to walk. Plus the hotel was down a small street which meant it was nicely tucked away from traffic noise. The wifi was not brilliant, it was very patchy! No complaints about the breakfast, it was plentiful and tasty. The desk staff were very helpful. They saved us a lot of money by directing us to a bus to the airport. We were ready to get a taxi, but the bus was much cheaper and pretty quick. We didn't use the swimming pool or spa, although I wish we had! We didn't use the parking either. All in all, a very nice hotel, I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: OlyFoodie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Spring Hill Suites for 3 nights, and were very happy with the property in general. The room was very clean, housekeeping and the front desk staff were helpful and efficient and our one complaint about the noisy air conditioning unit in our room was answered very quickly. However it couldn't be fixed, and we were told by the engineer that the a/c units are a problem in many of the rooms. It would occasionally get louder and louder until it sounded like an aircraft preparing to takeoff. Then it would suddenly get quiet again. That is our ONLY complaint about the hotel, though. If you want to see Old Montreal, this is the perfect location - it is centrally located and only a 10 minute walk to Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “A few caveats”
Reviews.Author: carlv247
Reviews.Content: A spur of the moment change in travel plans had us drive from Toronto (where we spent a wonderful day and night at the Courtyard Marriott Pearson Airport) to Montreal without a reservation. We had very bad luck at the Starwood chain once in California and we should have learned our lesson then. Springhill Suites disappointed, but not for the enthusiasm and dedication of the staff. To make a long story short: We liked: 1. Location! 2. Cleanliness of the room (but not the carpet or whatever they use to "clean" it. 3. Upbeat, can do attitude of the staff. 4. The bar. 5. Quiet rooms - we did not hear any noise from either the hallway or next door neighbors. 6. The beds - very comfortable though arguably not the best. We did not like: 1. Waking up with swollen throats from that cleaning agent they use. We neglected to turn open the vent of the A/C unit or to open the window (it was close to freezing at night) - our fault. However, we travel frequently and never have a problem. 2. Noise of the A/C unit. Front desk informed us that the hotel is in the process of replacing the units... 3. Breakfast, it was the most simple and ordinary we have had in a while and wasn't worth the price paid. The Courtyard breakfast is much better and offers more variety. We will not stay at a Springhill Suites again as a result of this mediiocre experience. There are other Marriott brand hotels in Montreal that offer much better value (in hindsight!). We would recommend you check those out instead. About the old town location, as long as you go at night you'll have a good time. During the day, you'll notice that the economy has taken a toll here as well. Homeless and drunk people abound, many store properties are empty and the area has a gloomy feel to it despite the grandeur of the old style buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: TheAnswer
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful hotel nestled right in the heart of old Montreal. It is two blocks from Notre Dame and across the street from the Palais de Justice. It is easily accessible centered between two metro stops on the orange line. Just walking around the block you will find plenty of souvenir shops, bars, and restaurants including Tim Hortons, Starbucks, the Keg, and Les 3 Brasseurs. The property is superbly maintained. The front desk staff and breakfast staff are very courteous and professional men and women. The hotel offers a pool, hot tub, spa, on-site restaurant, and business center with free internet. The free breakfast buffet has a generous offering of coffee, milk, juice, eggs, ham, cereals, oatmeal, toast, bagels, pastry, and fresh belgian waffles. The room was everything that I expected... clean, spacious, and comfortable. Room features include a king bed, pull-out sofa, flat-panel tv, kitchenette, internet connection (ethernet cable provided!), iPod-dockable clock radio, and morning paper on weekdays. Our room was on the topmost 6th floor which provided us a decent view of the river. Despite the flattery, the hotel does come with a couple of shortcomings. First, the free wireless internet is restricted to a very small zone which is basically the breakfast area. Drift so much as ten feet and you immediately lose connectivity. Secondly, the cost of parking is ridiculous. The hotel contracts with an adjacent garage and charges $19 valet parking per night. You can find free parking on the streets outside, but it is near impossible to do so on the weekends. And if you are lucky enough to find a spot, get ready to wake up early as parking is prohibited from as early as 6am. Other than that, I had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: lfresa
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel easy to find, beware street is narrow and one way. Two blocks from the Basilica of Notre Dame. Hotel was really nice and clean. We had a king bed and pullout coach. Room was smaller that it appeared on line but still really nice. It had s microwave and fridge in the room. We had free internet brought our own cable and laptop. Found it easy to exchange our American money for Canadian money right at the front desk. Breakfast in the morning was great. So much to pick from but you do have to go early. If you go the last hour it is beyond hectic. They had waffles, eggs, home fries, danish, fruit, yogurt, juice and coffee. You could not go wrong. They did have a pool but we did not check it out since we did not plan on using it. Hotel was right in the center of Old Montreal. Loved it, walked to St. Catherines St, took Metro to Little Italy and back. Montreal is a beautiful clean city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Bunny7475
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Valentine's weekend based on TA reviews & was not disappointed. We requested a room with microwave & refridgerator, which was about $20 more but came nicely equipped w/ wet bar. Very large living room space seperate from bedroom, both areas had big screen t.v. Ours was room 601, which had a small window w/ nice view of the quays, etc. Location cannot be beat. Plenty of restaurants & site-seeing right around the corner (literally). The only minor inconvenience was that the hotel's restaurant is closed Sun. & Mon. Kind of a bummer as those were the days we stayed & were hoping to eat there...oh well, next time. We plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnotherEnglishman
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal, right in the Old Town and close to great streets of restuarants, museums and so on. The hotel is old but well kept. Out suite was small and the view was of a brick wall, but we did get a bargain deal. I'd come here again, much more character than the more modern hotels near McGill.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: mam514
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of Old Montreal, within walking distance of Notre Dame. There are many great restaurants and shops nearby as well. The hotel itself is quite nice and very clean. The breakfast in the morning was a great way to start the day. The front desk is very helpful in mapping out places to see, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Pleasant Room”
Reviews.Author: AHunn
Reviews.Content: Being in the heart of Old Montreal made all the difference in the world. Great access to activities and tours, easy walk to Metro, and a pool, made our two young kids very happy. Though the hotel is not premium, it was clean and the staff was attentive. Breakfast at the hotel was not a plus; enough places around town much more preferable. Only downside, a drunk yelling in the alley outside was heard too clearly and not dealt with by the hotel after a call to them was made. Would still come back again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Pick”
Reviews.Author: Patty323
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never been to Montreal before and were picking hotels out of the AAA book and hoping for the best. This hotel was the Perfect Pick. Tucked away on a quiet street, but close to everything- restaurants, shopping and lots of Montreal site-seeing. We put the car away for 3 days and walked all over Old Montreal, and when we came back to our room it was an oasis for our tired feet. Beautiful room and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Kurt5280
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel from a AAA Travel Guide based only on location and price range and reserved a room on the telephone. Although the hotel is a little difficult to find we were pleasantly surprised from check-in to check-out. Our room was excellent with a large bathroom, small sitting room, built-in desk, and kitchenette ($170 CAD/Night). The hotel is ideally located between Chinatown (West), waterfront (East), nightlife (North), and cathedral (South). Although tripadvisor only rates this hotel as two stars, I believe it is four stars based on our experience with quality and services. For example, the staff opened the business office in the middle of the night so that I could use the computers for internet services (free). At the buffet breakfast (included) a staff member found an extra chocolate croissant for my wife during a very busy time. I made a valet request for my car and it was parked in front of the door before I got off the elevator. This hotel was our best experience while traveling two weeks in Canada!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, pleasant staff, acceptable rooms, good value for location”
Reviews.Author: Grendel_9
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, so obviously we are satisfied. I've recommended the hotel to others. The rooms are a bit smaller than you might expect from a suite, but they aren't cramped. The beds are quite comfortable. I've rated the location as excellent because most people seem to want to stay in the old town, and it's perfect for that, but I find the Plateau a much more interesting area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, air conditioners are very loud.”
Reviews.Author: csotwoVirginia
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a good hotel in a great location within walking distance of everything in Old Montreal. We had 2 rooms for extended families and the air conditioners (window units) in both our rooms were so loud and cycled of and off so frequently we had to turn them off to sleep. Because of this I cannot recommend this hotel during hot summer weather. I do not know if the heat would be as noisy in the winter. The complimentary breakfasts are typical of a Marriott hotel and yes there is not enough seating but they did open a conference room very close to the food. Complimentary coffee and tea are available from this area throughout the day which was very nice. The free internet was easy and fast. The suites sound bigger than they actually are especially if you need to use the sofa bed. Once the sofa bed is pulled out it completely blocks the path from the bed/bathroom to the hallway door. There is a very nice kitchenette area with computer desk, chair, microwave and mini-fridge. Other than the noisy air conditioner the hotel and surroundings were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Hill Suites in Old Montreal offer the Comforts Necessary for a Fine Stay”
Reviews.Author: zuzuspetals_NY
Reviews.Content: Subject: Residence Inn by Marriott - Montreal Downtown Location: Montreal, Quebec, Canada, North America Title: Great Stay in a Brillant Hide-a-way Spot! ID#: 35191593 I was very surprised by the hotel's location, on a deserted side street right in the middle of Old Montreal. The hotel was smaller than I thought it would be, as was our "suite." There was a large pullout couch, small refrigerator, one television, two double beds, workstation/desk - and certainly was enough for the four of us on our four night stay. Warning: when the pull out couch is out - it's hard to move from one area of the room to the other, without jumping across the bed itself. The hotel front desk got us tix to see a movie, and were quite helpful on what to see in the area. Breakfast was certainly plentiful with eggs, yogurt, breads, juice, waffles and such - the seating was a problem. With so many people trying to have breakfast before 9:30am - there were many people vying for seats. The staff made the conference room available, but those who immediately got off the elevators didn't know that - if either the front desk or if there was a sign it would have been better organized. The workers certainly were hard at work refilling or replacing during the breakfast rush. The pool was adequate, fine for the kids and I was able to work out while watching them in the pool - a very big plus! The internet at the hotel is "modem/dsl based" and I had a problem getting on - that was easily solved by calling the customer service to the company who carries the web capability. They were incredibly helpful and within mins. I was on the computer. This is a small city hotel in an old part of town. The charm of the front desk, accessibility to Old Montreal, the sites certainly do outshine the cramped feeling of the hotel. The hotel is clean, people are nice and while in Montreal, how often are you really in the room?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: mlcw
Reviews.Content: I can't argue with other reviewers that the location is fabulous for the Old Montreal area. It is close to all points of interest in Old Montreal and the Basilique Notre-Dame de Montreal. The hotel itself is probably a good place for families or business travelers who are traveling with their family, since the rooms are fairly large, and the continental brreakfast is included. However, the hotel can use some tender loving care ... the windows are absolutely filthy and really give the place an unseemly character. The carpet in all areas is worn and in need of being replaced, particularly in the room we occupied. This is the first Marriott brand where I was greeted with a towel with holes in it when coming out of the shower. The bedding was on the soft side and the room had nowhere to sit aside from a sofa and a desk chair. An extra chair in the room would have been nice, but would have taken up any extra space. The sink is separate from the bathroom which is nice, but it is a very small and tight area so only one person at a time can use it. The bathroom houses only the tub/shower and toilet which are extremely close together to make room for the door to open. The air conditioning works, however, it is an in-wall style air conditioner/heat system that makes a lot of noise when running. It was not difficult to hear noise from adjoining rooms or when people were out in the hall. Staff is certainly friendly and accommodating. The continental breakfast is adequate, however, the area on the mezzanine where breakfast is served is a bit cramped and gets very crowded during the morning rush. On occasion, it was difficult to find a place to sit. The Metro (subway) and train stations are a bit of a walk and are probably a half mile or so from this hotel. There is a bus, however, the 515 Vieux-Montreal/Vieux-Port that will take you to all the known sites in the area, as well as the Gare-Centrale train station. Buy a Carte autobus/metro or Carte touristique if you will be staying for three days or more. Overall, the hotel is adequate, and the best thing about it, at least in this reviewers opinion, is the location in Old Montreal and free internet access. Regardless, I would not be likely to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: rosie
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best Springhill Suites we have ever stayed in. It's not much to look at from the outside--looks like an old warehouse and it has a very small sign. The location is wonderful. We had our two teenage daughters with us.We really enjoyed staying in old Montreal. Inside, the rooms are quite nice. Our girls enjoyed the free internet. We thought the breakfast was good. (eggs, meat, hash browns, waffle station, pastries, muffins, bagles, cereal, yogurt, fruit, etc... It did get crowded but we always found a seat. I would recommend going later. They say it ends at 9:30, People were still eating at 10. The Auberge St. Germaine, connected to the back of the hotel ,is a very cool restaurant. It is expensive, they have a nice terrace for drinks. Our daughters enjoyed shopping on St. Catherines. Weren't really thrilled with the shopping on St. Denis. We rented bikes at the port and went along the canals. That was fun. Also enjoyed the views from on top of Mont Royal. (recommend driving)

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased...”
Reviews.Author: Lulu079
Reviews.Content: Stayed at SpringHill Suites this past weekend. Although location was fantastic, we were not pleased with service. Room had defective air conditioning units (no central air in the room) so it became hot when air was turned on low and noisy when turned on high. Also, we paid cash for our room but they took our credit card for incidentals. They still held the card for the full value of our complete stay and still has not released it. Very aggravating when you are travelling.

Reviews.Title: “The location, service and accomodations cannot be beat!”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyLuv2travel2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springhill Suites last week and I must say that it met all of my family's expectations and then some! The rooms were clean, modern and spacious for a hotel that was in the middle of a major city. The front desk personnel did not know too much about local eateries but were as helpful as they could be (this was also true of those who worked in the nearby souvenir shops)! The continental breakfast was always well stocked and offered a variety of foods to choose from. The rooms were just remodeled and clean. One step out of the lobby put you in the middle of a wonderful historic town. The downfalls: remembering to get everything out of your car before it is valet parked (although accessing your car was not difficult). The breakfast area could become too crowded at certain times. Our air-conditioning system was waayy too loud! Still a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ozwardies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Old Montreal which was great. Staying here is definitely right for you if you want to be close to everything in Old Montreal. The rooms are very nice. Breakfast is free and is ok though it was very busy and therefore not really a very pleasant in which to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for finding and returning baby's 'blankie'!”
Reviews.Author: KarenHeavens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Place D'Arme our first night in Old Montreal and were SO HAPPY when we moved closer to the port and into this more family friendly hotel. The suite was very clean and we loved opening the window and hearing the seagulls in the morning! Most importantly, i panicked after we left behind baby's 'blankie'. Thinking i would have to sneakily find a replacement, the chambermaid found it and Guillame at the front desk Fed Ex'd it to me! That made us so grateful. The location can't be beat, crepes and rental bikes out the front door! Enjoy la belle province!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Historic Montreal”
Reviews.Author: UsFuntraveler
Reviews.Content: Travel sites had advised me to not miss the Rue St. Paul area of Montreal, so when I found this new hotel in that area, I booked it. So happy with my choice! The hotel appeared new, but I learned that it had been recently completely remodeled. It was lovely. The beds and pillows were wonderful. We had our 3 college kids with us and there was plenty of room for all 5 of us. Lots of mirrors - two sinks and nice bathroom made getting ready in the morning go well. The complimentary breakfast was the standard fare with a few bonus items thrown in - hard boiled eggs and hot oatmeal. Lots of dining options around...some that stay open late. There is a beautiful restaurant attached to the hotel, but it was very pricey. Parking is in the garage next door. Easy walk to the Notre Dame. Subway is pretty close as well. Hotel staff are business professional, but don't go out of their way to be engaging, friendly or suggest tourist info. Hotel is tricky to find...our garmin was really struggling to get us there! It's kind of in an alley, but it doesn't feel unsafe at all. Great stay and would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice right in the heart of the old town”
Reviews.Author: BaselLisa
Reviews.Content: Springhill Suites doesn't look much from the outside, but the rooms are big and well-appointed. No views, but within seconds walking you're in the heart of quaint old Montreal. Breakfasts were great and although I didn't try them, the waffles seemed to be a big hit. I saw another reviewer say that you shouldn't visit Montreal if you're on a diet. Boy, is that the case! I've never seen such a concentration of restaurants in one town -- the food is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorOntario
Reviews.Content: An unclaimed jewel in the middle of Old Montreal. As we walked down the small side street off Rue Notre Dame my wife was getting second thoughts. She said...." I am not liking this". Well, she now admits she was wrong and as we entered this hidden away from the crowds hotel she relaxed and smiled as we entered the recently re-done foyer. The rooms, while small were clean and well stocked with towels. There was a hide-a-bed couch as well as work station and FREE internet!! YEAH!!!!! Mini fridge and microwave as well. The pool and hot tub were also small, but we weren't there for swimming. The hotel is so perfectly located that you are literally minutes from almost anything you wanted to see in old town. We tried many restaurants both inexpensive and expensive and have to say this hotel, part of the Mariott chain will always be at the top of our list. And the rooms rates were so reasonable as well. All in all, just a great find!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden secret in the heart of old town”
Reviews.Author: fjon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one nite to see a Cirque du Soliel performance at the old port. What a fantastic choice!!! The hotel is hidden in a side street just off Rue St. Paul in Old Montreal. You can walk almost everwhere....and that we did! Very convenient to all the sights and attractions of Montreal... The staff was very accomodating and went out of their way to attain dinner reservations at a nearby restaurant for us. Although the room was a bit compact; it had all the ameneties that you could need. I imagined being in the old port on a weekend nite may be a bit noisy; but we had a confortable, quiet nite's sleep. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and there were two people working to make sure there was enough food on the buffet for everyone. I would definitely stay here again....even better than the full service Marriott in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal Mothers Day Holiday”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousAnne
Reviews.Content: I went to the Spring Hill this past Mothers Day weekend. And while the weather was rather crummy, the stay at the Marriott was very enjoyable. The Room The room was huge. It was My parents, my sister and myself and while the beds were a double (slightly smaller than a queen) it was still enough space. I think the large sofa was a pull out and we could have slept on that, but there was really no need. We were however charged $30 extra dollars per (extra two) people per night. The room was clean, towels were ample (we asked for 4 more) big screen plasma TV with a substantial amount of English channels. It had many amenities including a working fridge, microwave, coffee peculator and coffee provided as well as a ironing board. The heater worked and you could open the window. All in all it was clean and comfortable. The Food The complimentary continental breakfast was great! I had no doubt mind you. Eggs, muffins, cereal (hot and cold) waffles, toast, sweet bread and hashbrowns. It was plentifull and enjoyable. You could take it up to your room or eat in their restaurant style mezanin. A+ Parking Parking was $20 a night. but well worth it. The parking lot across the street looked very sketchy and after hearing about all of the theft issues I decided to park in the underground parking. Well worth it. I was able to take my car in and out at will and the parking guys were very nice. Location The location was great. It was tucked away in the middle of old Montreal and you can essentially walk anywhere from the hotel. there are countless eclectic french restaurants in the area as well as many familiar chain fast food places. McDonald's and Tim Horton are right around the corner. You are withing a 2 minute walking distance to the water and pretty much every local attraction. Language Barrier Don't even worry about it. Everyone seems to be bilingual and happy to accommodate. Flaws I was disappointed that the hotel did not have wireless internet connection for my iTouch. Though the hotel does have a great little business room that has a computer, fax, internet etc. There is also in room connection if you brought your laptop. The Gym They do not advertise their gym on their site. It's not in any of the pictures. But I was hopeful. When I got there I saw some really great shots of a fully equiped gym with treadmills, Elliptical machines, free weights and machines. But when I got there it looked really run down. The elliptical was horrid and the treds looked like they had had better days. Same goes with all the equipment. I really looked nothing like the pictures. The greatest disappointment of the hotel. Also, to pool was dingy. It looked really bad. The hot tub was no better - gross. All in all I really enjoyed it! I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get some rest”
Reviews.Author: Marcel_&_Julie
Reviews.Content: Even if it's hidden, it's a wonderful place to stay. The buffet breakfast had practically everything I could think of, the staff was friendly and the location is great. There are numerous restaurants nearby to satisfy every traveler's taste, from pubs to patios to fast food and high end steakhouses. The subway station is roughly a 5 minutes walk away too. The value is wonderful with a kitchenette, fitness centre, high speed internet, and a pool on top of the breakfast, there's not much more one could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: anushian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the weekend of February 13th. Our travel arrangements were changed last minute and we ended up arriving about 3 hrs earlier than out requested check in of 11am. I called in around 4am to inquire about an early check in before our already requested early check in. The clerk could not guarantee and asked us to inquire upon arrival if a room was available. Unknown to us until we got there, the clerk had already notified the clerk on the next shift and a room was ready when we arrived. I felt this was above and beyond and to whoever was night auditor during the early morning hours of Feb13, thanks very much. The service was amazing. As for the hotel itself, I have no complaints. In was a terrific stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicolasjclement
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Hotel was convenient, room was very big (upgrade to a suite with 2 double beds for 2 adults...). Pool was very old though... Business centre with free internet was very good. Breakfast ok. Staff friendly and certainly helpful. Parking charge was promptly removed when I told I used the free outside parking spaces (rented car does not mind -20C / 5F :P ).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Minshara
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in Aug 2008. If you want to make Old Montreal the centerpiece of your Montreal stay, this place is perfectly situated. Exterior blended in locally, but interior was American in style, new & good quality, and very well sound-proofed. I thought the front desk staff were acceptable but not exceptional, as a few verbal exchanges got confusing with them (and it was not a language barrier). But ultimately, the hotel was well-run and of high quality. Supposedly the "oldest inn in North America - 1754" is connected to the hotel lobby. We walked through it and it looked old and stately, but we did not have the opportunity to eat there. There is a parking garage connected to the hotel, and we had no issues unlike the other unfortunate poster. The rooms were clean, and were appointed as expected for this class of hotel. A little more drawer space would have been nice, but it was not a big issue. The only problem we had with the hotel was the buffet breakfast. We were there a whole week, so we tried it on a variety of days. Now, we were there during the summer, and based on how crowded the lobby and hallways appeared to be, the hotel seemed to be no more than 50% occupied. Yet, the few times we tried to utilize the breakfast buffet, it was jammed. When the eggs went empty, it took a while for replacement food to be brought out. So, despite the extra cost, we opted for eating out. Eating breakfast American-style in Old Montreal can present its own challenge. Most of the breakfast places simply had croissants, fruit and the like. In the whole of Old Montreal, we only found three places that offered an American-style breakfast. The nicest place for this was in the Le Saint Sulpice hotel, a few blocks away. The other two were nearby, as well, but were more diner quality. When you are here, you are conveniently in the heart of Old Montreal, but on a street which itself is not busy. All of the Old Port, church and museum destinations are only a few blocks in any direction. The coolest thing we did was rent Segways. The Segway rental place is in the Old Port, on the last pier on the north end of the port. We also were there during the long fireworks festival that they have every summer. Again, going out to the pier area on the north end of Old Port will afford you a good view. For dining, there are any number of "historical" places besides the place in the hotel lobby that one can eat, such as Gibby's or Restaurant Place St-Paul. Strangely, both my wife and I thought that just about every glass of wine we drank was of poor quality. We thought we would be awash in high quality French wines, but either the Canadian taste in wines is non-existent, or the French ship them all of their low-quality product. As with any touristy area, the food is somewhat overpriced, but there are a fair amount of good-quality places that can be found. One other thing to look out for in Old Montreal is a complete lack of bank ATMs. There were plenty of the fly-by-night ATMs, but no bank ATMs at all - zero. As luck would have it, my bank debit card is very finicky about functioning with the cheap ATMs, so when we ventured out of Old Montreal, we had to cash up at a real ATM. Bottom Line: overall, hotel is of good value, in a good location, and you will get at least what you expect from it, if not more.

Reviews.Title: “In the Center of Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: HollisCross621
Reviews.Content: We loved the SpringHill Suites in Old Montreal as the hotel was one of the nicest Marriotts were have stayed at. Our 2 bedroom suite was roomy enough for the three of us. The room was clean and the beds were so comfortable. The breakfast was not be missed as it was the best "free" breakfast that I can recall at any hotel. The business center was like a lounge with 2 computers. The parking valet was efficient and very responsive with our car always waiting for us when we needed it. The SpringHill is in the very center of Old Montreal with all the shops, art galleries and restaurants an easy stroll away. Jacques-Cartier Place was ony a few blocks in one direction and Notre-Dame Basilica a few blocks in the other direction. For eats, we would highly recommend nearby Chez Suzette (crepes, fondue, soups, etc. ), and Jardin Nelson (music, open air courtyard). The Maple Delights shop was evrything it's name suggests! We had a wonderful time to help celebrate our daughter's 21st Birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: JoeytravelerNJ
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect too much except a clean room and good location. I thought the location was great - Old Montreal is right there. You can walk right out of the hotel and you have many restaurants, shops, & bars within a 10 minute walk. The Notra Dame Basillica is short walk away along with the Metro. The staff was very friendly and so helpful with getting around town, the Metro, sights to see, & driving directions. The morning breakfast was more than I thought it would be with hot eggs, waffles, yogurt, fruit, bagels, cereals and good coffee. The only drawback is that it can get crowded and on weekends you may have to wait for a table. They do have take out trays so you have the option of bringing it back to your room. The pool & hot tub is VERY small, so that was a little disappointing and the fitness room is also small with a treadmill, cross trainer and some weights. If you are driving there keep your eyes peeled for the street. It's a very tiny street off Rue Notre Dame & a block past Rue St Laurant. It looks like an alley way. I missed it twice. The street sign is on the building. I had a studio king suite. It was more than I expected. The bed was so comfortable. The bathroom was sizeable and it had the vanity and sink separate, which is great if you have 2 people staying there. The TV swiveled so you could turn it facing the bed or the sofa. It had a desk near the kitchenette, which had a sink, mini-fridge, and microwave. It was perfect to store some snacks and drinks. I didn't mind relaxing in my room, it was very comfortable and I enjoyed it very much. They also offer AAA discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience! Beware of the "secure" parking!”
Reviews.Author: JL818
Reviews.Content: My stay at the SpringHill Suites Marriott in Old Montreal was fair at first. The hotel is nothing spectacular but is centrally located. The pool is too small to even complete one lap, and the rooms that they say can fit 3 individuals are too small for even 2. The trip took a nose dive when I parked my car at the "secure" parking garage next door - Seville Parking. After checking out I went to pick up my car and noticed a huge dent on the front fender with yellow paint on the wheel and the side of the car. I confronted the attendants who denied any responsibility and provided me with a business card for Leo Garlick, the garage director. I live in New York, and we checked out on a Sunday, so there was no possibility of discussing the incident with the director in person. I called from NY the next day, and after leaving several messages for the garage, I finally contacted him on his cell phone! Both the garage and the hotel claim no responsibility for the accident. Yet, the hotel is the one that processes the charges for the garage. I asked the garage director for records of the car having been moved out of the garage and still I have received no documentation. I discussed with the hotel manager, Christine Marchand, the situation and she rudely brushed me off by saying she would talk tot he parking garage director and get back to me. She never called me back. Both the Marriott and Seville Parking employees have been unresponsive and extremely unhelpful. I would not recommend either to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: klpsmom
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location in Old Montreal and within easy walking distance of the Metro, the Old Port, Place Jacque-Cartier, La Basilica Notre-Dame and great restaurants. Our 4 kids (ages 10-15) loved our stay in Montreal. The lobby was clean and updated, the bi-lingual hotel staff very friendly and accomodating, and the suites very clean and comfortable. The small "kitchen" area w/ sink, fridge and microwave was a huge plus for our family. One small negative was the pull out sofa looked like it would pull out to a double bed, but only one person could sleep on it comfortably. Indoor pool was very small. The breakfast buffet was very good and well stocked but could get very busy and it was difficult at times to get seating but they provided carry out containers and disposable utensils which made it very convienient to carry back to your room. Overall, had a great stay here and would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: billythekid54
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel in Old Montreal that was reasonably priced. We checked TripAdvisor and based on the favorable reviews and recommendations, we booked a stay for three nights. The location was excellent and even though the hotel is hidden on a side street, the interior was updated and very nice and clean. The breakfast buffets were good and best of all were included in the price. Staff were bilingual and attempted to answer our questions to the best of their ability. Parking was right next door and staff were efficient. We took our car out about 2 times a day - no problem. Housekeeping services were great. Staying at this hotel definitely added to our enjoyment of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: MAG10
Reviews.Content: We booked the room through Marriott and were happy with our choice from several perspectives. The location was good with respect to nearby sites, proximity to subway (a 5-10 minute walk) when necessary and choice of restaurants--which were abundant in the vicinity. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room, while not overly large, was comfortable, quiet and clean. We are a family of 3 and but did not feel particularly cramped. Breakfast was considerable, included in the cost of the room. Internet access was easy with two free computers available in the Business Center and the exercise room was appreciated, though rather small. Overall, no regrets and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: teen28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location in Old Montreal. About 10 blocks to the IGA supermarket, which I suggest going to first and buying some food to keep in your fridge at the hotel. Food is very expensive. $17 for 2 meals at Mcdonalds 4 blocks away. Subways is also 4 blocks away. We called for a large Dominos pie $20. We took a 30 minute horse and buggy ride for $45. I dont think it was worth it. The driver took us down the same path we just walked around! Make sure you ask for a scenic route. Metro is around 10 blocks away. Bkft at the hotel is waffles, bagels, pastries, cereal, muffins, the only fruit was oranges. Took the Bateau Mouche boatride and enjoyed that. Do the 60min ride instead of the 90min. They serve drinks and snacks, but it is a little pricey. Took the train to Olympic park. Very interesting and would recommend for the athlete in the family. You can even go swimming for a small charge in the pool that was used in the Montreal Olympics! There is a movie theatre alongside the park if you wanted to spend extra time not shopping! The hotel staff were all very polite and helpful, they even ordered my Dominos! Umbrellas were avl when it rained. Internet worked great. No charge for 800 numbers from the room. The only problem was the loud a/c. Its one of the indoor/outdoor ones and even if yours is shut off, you can hear your neighbors. You dont need a car to get around. Taxis are $35 from the arpt and the hotel will order one for you if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Will go back again”
Reviews.Author: Rockingtraveler
Reviews.Content: What a great convenient hotel. This is more like a boutique hotel than a Marriott. Efficient, friendly,knowledgeable, bilingual front desk clerks. We had the suite for 3 adults - about $200. Full breakfast is served. Room has micro, fridge, coffee pot, ironing board, iron, tv, clock/radio, sitting area, dining table, sofa (sofa bed??). The room was very clean, the bedding was very comfortable. Quiet in the room. Comfortable lobby nice for reading and people watching.There is garage and valet parking, I did not inquire about pricing. Convenient to many activities and sights. The Basilica is just 5 blocks, the archeology museum about 5 blocks, galleries and shops just around the corner. Many eateries and pubs in the area. Flat rate taxi fare to airport is $35 - check with front desk to schedule. Shuttle to airport is $15 per person. This is very close to the cruise pier, you could walk, but it will probably be easier to take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but staff not too helpful for tourists”
Reviews.Author: exchelente
Reviews.Content: Staff was not helpful to tourists. Felt like we were bothering them by asking for a map and some insider travel tips beyond generic tourist spots. We're in our early 30's and were looking for boutique shops, cool live music spots, and the hotel staff was not helpful at all. Maybe that's because we seemed to be the only guests under 65 yrs old. Our suite was decent, but very generic decoration. If you want something special w/ charm, check out some of the boutique hotels nearby if you can spend a little more money. We had a room above the pool (which is more like a large bathtub). Clean, large room. Minifridge. Our room had a door out to a patio enclosed by walls, which seemed nice at first but a little scary for security since one window was unlocked when we checked in. Dislikes - 1. windows didn't have drapes to cover the whole window, good thing it wasn't sunny or we wouldn't have been able to sleep in. 2. staff was not helpful for tourists looking for off the beaten path info. Likes - 1. Waffle maker at continental breakfast 2. Valet was easy 3. CarsEatFree promotion, free valet parking and $25 gas gift card per night (gas card could only be used at petrol canada gas station though, and hotel gave us directions to the wrong gas station on checkout - good thing our GPS helped us find the right gas station chain!) 4. Location was good for touristy museums and old montreal, but next time we may stay near downtown area to be closer to nightlife ... or near the little portugal part of town up st. laurent where the hip funky boutique SOHO-NYC style neighborhood is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Us!”
Reviews.Author: brittial
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in early May and were very happy with this hotel. The room was very large for two people and well laid out, impeccably clean, extremely comfortable, and in a location that was perfect. We came in by train, with a taxi to the hotel costing about $10 including tip, but the Metro was only a few blocks away. Personnel at every level were helpful and polite. While the pool and hot tub were small, I didn't have any trouble finding time to use them when there was no one else there. The breakfast was plentiful; attendants re-stocked constantly, although the hot selections were mostly the same each day. (We did not eat at the restaurant affiliated with the hotel for other meals.) The only complaint I would make -- and it is not something the hotel has any control over -- a freight train runs close to the waterfront, several blocks away. It came through before 6 a couple of mornings and was rather startling, especially until we realized what it was. Otherwise, even though we were on the "first" floor (just above street level), at the front of the building, right near the elevator, and on the same floor as the pool, we were not aware of any noise issues. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience in MontreaL - Will Go Back...”
Reviews.Author: HikerDave
Reviews.Content: My wife won 2 nights at the Springhill Suites Hotel in Old Montreal through a school raffle. Since we live in Maryland, I didn't really see how 2 free nights was such a big deal - but then we got very cheap airfare through the internet... SpringHill Suites (by Marriott) a non-smoking hotel, is located on a very small side street just around the corner from the Cathedral de Notre Dame in Old Montreal. A few hundred feet down the street from the hotel door is the cobbled stone street of Rue St. Paul. We took a direct taxi from the Int'l airport (YUL) all downtown trips from there are fixed at $35. We had room 501, which is a "deluxe" suite in a corner room. For the 2 of us it was very spacious. All previous reviews do a good job describing the various amenities; large bathroom, microwave, fridge, etc. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. They speak French & English interchangeably. Breakfast is a few steps up from Hampton Inn fare. Wafflemaker with fresh batter, always one hot quiche (egg) dish, sausage, and a large variety of upscale muffins, bagels, and pastries. For a hundred room hotel, there is lots of seating, but at 10:00am on Sunday, the place was packed... Had lunch at La Marche de LaVillette, several blocks down on Rue St. Paul. It is a stereotypical "French Bistro" food was great - recommend the ham & cheese crepe - great place overall. Dinner was the the Pub St. Paul - the hamburger was fine, beer was fresh, old pub atmosphere was nice, but I was underwhelmed. Since the hotel is in Old Montreal, the Rue de St. Catherine shopping area is a 10 minute walk, but we armed ourselves with a guidebook (Fodor's) and maps and just took off. Last Saturday had temperatures below 32 fahrenheit, but the wind chill put the temps way down into the teens. We had a blast exploring the various parts of the Underground City - blocks after blocks of it, just fascinating... On Sunday, we bought an All-day Touriste Metro card for $9 and explored parts of the city (including the casino) that were much farther away. Got way up on Rue St. Denis and went to Scwartz's Deli for their "Smoked Meat" sandwich (medium fat). It's not pastrami - really something else entirely - not to be missed! Shared our table with 3 "sixty-something" French Canadian ladies who spoke both French and English with equal aplomb - "Eh?" Overall, no - we didn't pay for the room, but it was a nice suite and I understand that the rates are very reasonable. Were we to go back to Montreal, we would definitely stay there again, even paying this time!

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: We had extra Marriott points and instead of heading south for the February break we headed north into Montreal. While we ended up paying for one of the three nights we stayed at Springhill, I would stay here again based on a nice stay. Used a google map to find it coming from the U..S. and the map was dead on. It's down a little, narrow street, and then the drivethrough entrance hooks to the left and you are there. Parked at entrance, took out bags and checked in w/in 5 minutes. Very nice,efficient front desk and they all answered our questions during our stay remarkably well. They spoke both French and english and were great w/ restaurant selections. Room was big, not huge for a suite and one of the kids stayed on the pullout couch every night. Bathroom was large but unremarkable. Room was always very clean, the maid responded well to a couple of extras we needed and the shower was hot. Pool and hot tub were small ( clean) but manageable as they had few people in them. Workout room was tiny as well. Our room overlooked the narrow street and we heard and were woke up evey night by a drunk or two, but it was not a constant stream of cars or people. Breakfast was good, not great although the selection was very good. Served over 3 hours, we did not find a crowd any of the 3 times we ate and were able to use a take out container every day for our cranky teenager who slept in every day. Terrific restaurants w/in walking distance. Our favorite by far (Only open 8-5, no dinner) was cafe/bistro Marche de LaVillette who had the funniest french waiters, the atmosphere was terrific, the music too loud and it made the place fun, very casual but really great for a family looking for respite from the cold and they even made our teenager eat his salad and laugh (while being dragged away from his friends at home.) We walked to the underground shopping and several downtown areas which took 10-15 minutes.Checkout was great. Parking garage did not bring our car down and finally approached me as I was standing outside and said our car battery was dead. It's a Suburban w/o any problems over the last 5 years so they must have killed it somehow and through a lot of negotiation, we were able to jumpstart it. At $24 per day, I was underwhelmed. Springhill provides a really pleasant experience and the locale in Old Montreal was unbeatable. Loved Marche de LaVillette (4 blocks away on St. Paul street) and would eat there every day just for the fun and laughs.

Reviews.Title: “Galleries & museums within a short walk”
Reviews.Author: Javabear
Reviews.Content: We loved the location in Old Montreal. Galleries, museums and the Science Museum are all within a short walk from the hotel. Rue St-Paul has many galleries to browse and several cafÃ©s nearby to try some croissants. The hotel has great facilities geared towards business travelers. Nonetheless, our family enjoyed the pool, hot tub and the delicious breakfast buffet. Babysitting needs to be reserved 5 hours inadvance at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: balf70
Reviews.Content: excellent property, better than some full Service Marriotts i've stayed in. The Location was supberb with lots of restaurants minutes from hotel. Room was large and very clean, staff very friendly and helpful - great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay...”
Reviews.Author: gottravelbug
Reviews.Content: This was a very large, clean, comfortable room with kitchen area and desk apart from sleeping area. The included breakfast was very good. I expected a continental breakfast, but there was much more. The staff were very pleasant. It would be great if all hotels were as nice. The only negative thing I can say -- and I don't want to sound too picky -- but I stayed two days and it looked like housekeeping came in and made the bed but didn't do anything else. The floor should have been vacuumed as the carpeting was dark and showed lint, and dirty glasses should have been replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: jadebay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this comfortable hotel for two nights in early October 2007 before boarding the ship Maasdam for the Canada New England cruise. The cab fare to the pier was $7.00; while it's within walking distance, one wouldn't want to walk there with luggage. It is located close to the pier, Notre Dame Basillica (a must see), many shops, art galleries and restaurants. While the subway is also nearby, there are a LOT of stairs, going up and down, before you get there. We are a senior couple and had some difficulty with that. The cost of a one way fare is $2.75; we took the train to the Botanical gardens but took a cab back; cost of cab was $16.00; the gardens are located right beside the Biodome. we enjoyed the gardens but they are probably best seen in spring or summer or earlier in the fall. The fare from the airport by cab was $35.00; we encountered a very rude cabbie but that was the only unpleasant part of our stay. The staff at the hotel were cheerful, helpful and very pleasant. The complimentary breakfast buffet included cold and hot cereals, juices, breads, muffins, waffles, a nice cheese and asparagus egg dish, make your own waffles, fruit and yogurt; something for everyone. There are many restaurants very close by; we had one dinner at the Modavie and the early bird special was $16.00. We found the hotel "homey" and convenient. The air conditioning was noisy but I have yet to find one that isn't. As others pointed out, there is no view. We didn't use the pool or any other hotel facilities; there is an ironing board with iron in the room and a hair dryer. Also a complimentary daily paper. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location & Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janices7
Reviews.Content: The Spring Hill Suites is located in the heart of Old Montreal only a few blocks from the waterfront, the Notre Dame Bascilica and Jacques Cartier Place which has tons of restaurants and shops. We had a suite that overlooked the small alley that fronts the hotel. The room was large and clean. The hotel has a lot of business guests, but was perfect for us tourists too with lots of maps and activity brochures. The front staff was helpful with suggestions of where to eat and knowledgeable about city activities such as the double-decker tour bus. The breakfast buffet was fantastic with a huge array of foods ranging from cold cereals, to eggs and bacon, to a make your own Belgian waffle station. They had something for everyoneâ€™s taste buds. For dinner, try Galiano's Italian Restaurant which is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose The Springhill”
Reviews.Author: theloft
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for us & friends after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Used Marriot.com direct. Reduced rate for Seniors. Could not have chosen better, rooms excellent, location brilliant. The staircase from the lobby could do with re-carpeting, but the lifts/elevators were good, so not a problem. The reception staff were multi-lingual and extremely helpful. We had an excellent meal at the bottom of the street, in Umberto's restaurant. All in all, could not have chosen better, thanksto Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “je ne sais quoi”
Reviews.Author: applauso
Reviews.Content: Springhill Montreal is situated right in Old Montreal. Literally walking distance to all Old Montreal sites. We really enjoyed the restaurant when Charles Dickens wrote "A Tale of Two Cities", which was walking distance from the hotel. The suite was super clean, spacious and the breakfast came in REALLY handy. One morning, being on vacation time, headed down to breakfast around 9:50, but the breakfast is technically over during the weekdays at 9am. To our surprise, everything was still out, people were eating so we got to jump in late. Plus, we were taking a train to Toronto on Monday, I got to make peanut butter jelly sandwiches for the journey. Worked out well. The staff is helpful in that they answered my tourist questions with map in hand and had a cab waiting when we checked out. Oh yeah, the free internet in the business center was a bonus also. To make a long story short. We were in a great location. And the rooms were great. Even my mom, who is self-admittedly one of the pickiest people you would ever meet, loved this place. And that means A LOT! Montreal is a lot of fun. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarasada
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bed and sleeper sofa room on Sep 2st 2007.The hotel is located in the old montreal in a small alley. If you checkin in the day time it is easy that you can find this hotel. All the road sign and the name written on each road is in french. The name board for the road is smallar than the normal size. We checked in around 11.00 PM. Since we have navigation system it was really easy to get into this hotel. In the dark without navigation system I believe it will be little bit difficult. The room was good and clean. The hotel is in a very good location. All the main attraction like Notre-Dame Basilica, old port and St.Paul Street (Famous for Cobblerstone street) are in a walkable distance.The breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, in a modern clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pdelis50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days in late August, everything was smooth, from an early check-in ( as we arrived around 12:30 PM) quiet room, Hotel is located on a side street one block from the popular St Paul's street and a few short blocks from Jacques Cartier Place in old Montreal. Safe area. Plenty of hotels and cafes near by. All the items of a good hotel, Staff was helpful when asked with directions etc. Hotel got us taxis on numerous occasions and hours (as we also took a day trip via rail to Quebec City) with ease. 15 minute walk to downtown. Small pool, but fine for a quick dip. Clean spacious, quiet and comfortable room. Breakfast was fine as well. Would stay again no problem, should I go back to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: croes
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have wished for a better location in Vieux Montreal for our 2 night stay on 15th and 16th August. Close to Rue St. Paul and the waterfront, also Place D'Armes metro (very easy to use) is only a 5-10 minute walk away. Check in and check out very straight forward and efficient. Underground parking for 2 days cost us around Â£20 (including taxes) - not too unreasonable given the location. Room was very spacious for the 4 of us as we were accompanied by our children, aged 12 and 9, having 2 queen beds, 2 TVs, a sitting area, a small kitchenette which included a fridge, microwave and a sink. The only (slight) negative would be the air conditioning units which were a bit on the loud side but did not prevent sleep. The buffet breakfast served on the mezzanine level was very good. I cannot comment on the pool as we never used it (too much to see and do in Montreal).

Reviews.Title: “Better than their Marriott Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Lorimisty
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel. Great location. Large Rooms with 2 TV's. Mini fridge and microwave in room is great for families. Best of all...comfortable beds, crisp, clean linens, fluffy pillows. Nicer than many Marriot hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: smoky624
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our two college age children (male and female) and it was difficult to find accomodations without booking 2 rooms. We spent extra and booked a deluxe suite with a king size bed. There were 2 sizes and we booked the larger. I was very pleased since when you walk in there is a area with the wet bar, microwave, and counter, along with a small table and 2 chairs. A roll-away bed can fit in here. There is a divider to a small living area with a sofa bed and chair. To the left is a small hall to the bedroom. We spent 3 nights here and never felt like we were on top of each other. The hotel is literally yards from the streets with the restaurants and shops. There is a room with two computers to access the internet, great breakfast, and free lollipops at the front desk. They were very helpful with recommendations and arranging cab service to the airport. I was concerned when I read the post from the woman about the man at her door, but was never concerned for my safety. The Metro was about a 10 minute walk, right next to Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome all around!”
Reviews.Author: Jfro
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a girl's weekend for my friend's birthday. What a great deal for the money. The hotel is very pretty, is in an excellent location right in old Montreal, has great customer service and is super clean and up to date. We had a fantastic time and you can't beat the location. There was a parking garage and we parked our car right there and never picked it up til we left Montreal. I think this would be a great hotel for families with young children to couples to a girl's or boy's weekend as well! I have stayed in other hotels in Old Montreal for getaways with my husband that are quite lovely, but also the price reflects it. Again, you can't beat this place if you want convenience and amenities on a budget. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: needvacationah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just around the corner from the narrow streets of Old Montreal. If you walk 2 blocks south, you will be at the Pier of Old Montreal. The Montreal Science Center is located here. The hotel is well kept and clean. The rooms are clean. The double beds are a bit soft and not as comfortable as the beds of previous Marriott hotels I have stayed at. The two double beds room can sleep 4 to 6 individuals. There is a sofa bed in the room that can sleep two young kids. The microwave, coffeemaker and small bar bridge are very handy. The morning breakfast that is included by the hotel is very convenient. It can get very crowded at times. The early morning sittings are less crowded. The breakfast is available from 6 to 10 am. It seems to be always busy after 9 am. The hot items include sausage patties, hash brown potatoes, scarmbled eggs and waffles. There is plenty of cereal, muffins, pastries, yogurts, bagels, breads and fresh fruits. They provide take out containers for the pastires and drinks. The swimming pool is very tiny. It can be very crowded when there are 6 kids in the pool. The staff are very courteous and the check in and check out was handled very efficiently. The restaurant attached to the hotel is very quaint but the prices were a bit steep. Around the corner from the hotel is the Keg restaurant. There are many sidewalk cafes within one to two blocks from the hotel. There is a Subway and McDonalds also one block away from the hotel. Everything is within walkable distance. There are two subway stations within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The Chinatown is also 5 minutes away. Had dinner at a Chinese restaurant in Chinatown called Ruby Rouge. The food was very good and the pricing was very reasonable ($75 for a set dinner for 6). Do visit the Biodome, Olympic Stadium, Botanical Gardens and Biosphere. Avoid the Montreal Science center. Montreal was a lovely city to visit. The streets were clean. The traffic and drivers were courteous. The staff at the stores, restaurants and attractions were all very polite and friendly. The fare from the airport was $40 to the downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Old Montreal's Best Deal”
Reviews.Author: skywaker9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a find. It is in a great location, about four blocks from Notre Dame de Montreal and two form the harbor but is not a quiet side street. Views are nonexistent but at this price, that's what you get. The rooms are nice, although be aware that many of the suites essentially have a half wall instead of a separate room. However, the sofa bed is comfortable and the area has its own TV. In addition, internet access is also free and very fast. Finally, the included breakfast is more than you would expect for the price and is certainly welcome. I would stay here again every time I go to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “miserable check in”
Reviews.Author: billbooks
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmed travelocity reservation which the front desk clerk refused to honor. He told us the reservation was invalid. We had a confirmation number from both travelocity and Marriott, and our reservation had been prepaid. We argued with the clerk for an hour and finally had to call travelocity and they had to call the hotel to get the clerk to honor our prepaid reservation. I have never experienced such rudeness and will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Condescening, Non-caring, American-Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MizzMocha
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. I was in Montreal for business and the accommodations were perfect. A nice mini-kitchen, a desk to work on, and complimentary Internet access were included en suite. The bed was comfortable and the room was spacious. The room was clean and the bathroom was large with a separate shower and tub. My problem was the staff. The problem was so great that everything good about this hotel didn't matter by the time I left. I arrived at the hotel on a Thursday and checked out on Monday. When I arrived I presented my credit card for incidentals. I later learned that the front desk charged the entire room stay on my card. Whenever my company sends me out of town for business, it pre-pays the hotel room through whatever travel agent/travel site it goes through. Well, there was a problem with Orbitz so while they provided a credit card, the room was not, in fact, paid for. My travel manager immediately started working to solve the problem by doing a third-party authorization. Trying to get the hotel desk to handle the third-party authorization was a nightmare. It took almost till the end of my stay to correct the problem. That, however, turned out to be the least of my worries! Sunday morning as I was preparing to leave my room to go to the convention center, someone knocked on my door. I was puzzled as I had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on my door. I was in the bathroom applying my makeup but went to the door to see who was there. There was a strange man at the door. He was not a hotel employee--he was wearing street clothes--no uniform. I asked who he was and what he wanted. He mumbled something in French and I told him he had the wrong room. He then said something else and again I asked him who he was looking for and got another answer in French. Again I told him he had made a mistake. He then switches to English and tells me to open the door again. Again I let him know he's at the wrong room. I walked away from the door, thinking nothing of it and went back to applying my makeup. About a minute later, there's a loud, insistent knock on my door. The man has not gone away. He then begins to beat on the door with his fists, telling me to open the door and that he was tired of joking and this wasn't funny. Stunned, I yell through the door that he has the wrong room, and if he doesn't go away immediately, I will be calling security (at which point I'm already heading to the phone). While I am dialing the front desk, the man starts jiggling the door handle, beating even harder with his fists, and yelling for me to open the door. I'm a woman, and I'm traveling alone, and I'm not easily frightened, but this had me a bit afraid. Here's the good part: I reach the front desk and tell them to send security up immediately as there is a strange man pounding on my door trying to get in. Front desk's response: "It's probably just housekeeping." WHAT???? I cannot tell you my utter shock at that response! As calmly as possible I tell the front desk clerk that it is NOT housekeeping, as I have a "Do Not Disturb" sign on my door and housekeeping wears a uniform and does not bang on the door with fists. This idiot at the front desk kept insisting it was housekeeping, and asked me if I knew the person at the door. Finally the clerk, who should have been able to hear the would-be intruder in the background, says he's sending someone up. Well of course the culprit is gone by the time someone arrives--and guess whom they sent up? Not security--a member of housekeeping! I ask the man from housekeeping if he saw anyone who fit the description of the man who was beating on the door. He could barely speak English and said he didn't see anyone. I then ask him to please stick around for about 3 minutes so he can walk me out, as I had to leave for the convention center. He promptly turned around and left! After nervously checking the hallway, I departed my room and promptly went to the front desk and asked for the manager. Of course it was too early for the manager to be in. The front desk clerk wanted to then know how he could help. Checking my anger I let him know that I was not happy with the way things were handled. I called with a serious concern and got brushed off as if I'm too stupid to tell the difference between a hotel employee and a possible assailant. Guess what the front desk clerk said? "It was a member of housekeeping". I asked him if members of housekeeping were prone to beating on guests' doors with their fists while shouting. Again, this clerk tells me it was housekeeping, saying a member from housekeeping went to my room.
